HBoSAjIuGMn3YzYT4vd86A.text: Don't expect much from this place. Place is dingy, especially for it being in Scottsdale. The service was okay, but the sushi rolls were sub par. There was even one roll, the group couldn't even finish because the fish tasted old.   We won't be back.

xCoS0tJq4OlDCVBQAbqo6g.text: Point break roll - awesome!  Soft-shell crab - best I've ever had!  I love Kyoto!  With choices to sit, eat, and drink at 1) the bar, 2) tables, 3) teppan table, and 4) sushi bar - you can live it up in many delicious ways!  Located near other good sushi places, this one you may not see from the street.  So I think this place is more known by the locals, and oh so good.  Very nice service, and less pretentious than the others just up the street.  I recommend this for a couple on a date, or a small group.  The teppan table seats 6 or 8, which is also fun for a little party, anniversary, birthday, etc.

hDY6KmnRQSiY65cCIEcjYw.text: Food was great, chef was great but the waitress was awful. The place was not busy at all and we never got refills from the server, never got asked by the server how our meal was, and we're given the bill until 40 minutes after we were done eating. It was brought by another server.

fV_2S8CYn6JB8wC4pcDvIQ.text: I went to Kyoto with some girlfriends from work and we had a blast. Let me just say their bento lunch specials cannot be beat.   To start, we all ordered the miso soup- IT WAS EXTRAODINARY! I would live off that soup if I could. It had so many mushrooms in it which I love. For my meal,  I got the chicken in teriyaki sauce- which came with salad, rice, and orange slices. I ate it all. The best part all of my meal was only $6.   I had friends get the sashimi and the tempura bento boxes. I think I might try the tempura box the next time we go. The server and host were very nice.

kTpRDTJFCayAfJvr1xPuOQ.text: I haven't visited for lunch - which apparently I am missing out on based on the reviews below!   Anyway, I have been twice for a dinner and it has been sub-par.  Most recently I visited this past weekend 8/24/13.  Sure, they may have the cool fire and loud, clanging spatulas - but it seems like more gimmicky than anything; I would take Benihana over Kyoto any day. Also, the staff we had both times were also sub-par.... which truly fulfills the need for this restaurant to be rated "Meh. I've experienced better."

rlLqGcI52yoBIaT4TSX4Lw.text: CLOSED....I just called and got the updated message that due to unforeseen problems with the renovation...they won't reopen til JANUARY possibly FEBUARY...hopefully they get it together and can reopen soon...l like Kyoto

baz2KgeZWW05L_A1ZGSUMg.text: First the valet tried to force us to valet by telling us he needed to back our car in. I asked him why? Am i required to park backwards? He said no, i need to back it in so i can pull it out easier. I said is valet parking required in this lot? He said no, to which i responded i didnt valet so youre not pulling my car out. I understand it was slow and he wasn't getting any tips but i didn't appreciate someone trying trick me into something. When we got there we had about an hour n a half to eat n get to our movie. The service was slow, it took forever to get any food and they only brought out one item at a time. We sat there for a long time with empty plates before the next came out. We ordered 5 things so it took a very very long time and they had 4 or 5 sushi chefs and it was not busy. By the third i had to ask them to see what was going on because we had a movie to catch. The food was pretty good though. Aside from that our waitress only checked on us once at the end of the night and the plates were pretty visibly worn. Which i know I'm anal but it bothers me. Get some decent plates they shouldn't be full of chips and wear. The manager comped me for taking so long with our food but i dont care about $10 I care about good service. Overall not a good experience. Pretty disappointed because i used to go there a lot years ago and i told my gf how good it was and they made me a liar lol. I wouldn't go back. Good sushi places are a dime a dozen now and if im eating raw fish id like to see that they take their job seriously.

2ULI6ZuS8J7Lr4d2i633mQ.text: I have been to Kyoto several times and food is good for the PRICE especially lunches. Phoenix has surprisingly good sushi restaurants and Kyoto is one of them. It's not NY nor LA but...  My biggest beef(or tuna) with Kyoto is their lack of sympathy for people with service animal. They DO NOT allow service animals in their restaurant.  We have two Yorkies and they are our service  dogs.  We have never been denied access to a restaurant before. This is not very AMERICAN. Maybe it's a Japanese thing:(  Anyway NO GO for animal lovers!

NrLNdn65jf0QCMieqsHe9Q.text: Not impressed. The service was slow and they never asked for drink-refills. The waitress seemed to be MIA most of the night.   I was excited to hear that they serve GLUTEN FREE soy sauce but you have to watch how they prepare it. They poured normal soy sauce all over my meal and I had to have them recook mine. We had a large group of ppl (15) and we agreed we won't be returning.   On a positive note.....the sushi was awesome!

5agi_aPP2GaguN9eZc3Q-Q.text: Came in for dinner with a party of 10. Booked a reservation last minute and unfortunately did not read the reviews fully. Not impressed. The first problem was when we asked for the sushi to come out as appetizers and our server condescending told us that they can try but it "depends on how backed up the sushi guys are". That's an actual direct quote. This server was not attentive, constantly darting away from the table before we could ask for drinks, silverware, etc. The beef bullion soup that comes at the beginning of the meal tasted like they put sliced mushrooms in a bowl of ramen broth. No complaints about teppanyaki chef, but one of the tricks resulted in an actual ball of fire igniting startlingly close to the head of the four year old at the table (this is no exaggeration as we have it recorded on video). Other off putting things about this restaurant include a $7.00 up charge for fried rice and miso soup instead of the ramen broth and steamed rice it came with, crazy loud customers at other tables, bussers and food runners who literally put down plates of food hanging off of the table, and the large screen TVs in the background playing a True crime cold case file complete with closed captioning. The icing on the cake was when we waited almost 10 minutes for the server to pick up the cash payment portion of our bill (large party and some paid in cash some with cards) and she never came. We finally just got up and left- leaving the money on the table- and the hostess stopped my mother at the door and said "excuse me miss, did you pay the rest of your bill?". Not a nice way to treat your customers- especially when they have a check close to 400 dollars. I'd like to reiterate that the food wasn't bad but won't be coming back. It was an awkward and unwelcoming experience.

Xc23R7BgS4bEyJU-Oz_CJQ.text: My husband and i have visited Kyoto many times prior to the recent closing.  We were very excited to return as our experiences have always been positive.  What a disappointment!  I ordered a Grey Goose vodka martini;  they did not have Grey Goose nor any premium vodka.  The fried rice was brought from the kitchen rather then made on the teppenyaki table and was tasteless.  We ordered scallops (received 2) and the chicken and steak were just ok, certainly not worthy of the $38.00+ cost. The chef, although nice enough, did not have the skill to pull off this type of cooking. ..

Phxvug5I4yhRZqGceC32SA.text: I love this place and I love the manager Dwayne he's so friendly, the staff is always nice, atmosphere's amazing, food is fabulous.. I totally recommend it and there teppanyaki bar's great too.

88UmBBYciMcNNpitlxuf4A.text: We went here on Valentine's Day for a friend's birthday.  I do love that it is a local version of Benihana's.  But they are lacking in their flavor.  I wish they would have made the fried rice in front of us instead of bringing it out with our food already made.  Sure, this would make it like all those other places...except this meant we only got to watch the chef make our grilled veggies and meat.  It made for a slightly less exciting experience.  We did enjoy our food though and it is worth at least one trip in, especially if you are a supporter of local restaurants.  Don't come in thinking it is like the bigger more mainstream versions though.

CtaDK5jjeeCxB6rQGo0lmQ.text: Sushi: 2/5 I ordered softshell crab maki roll and another maki roll that I can't quit recall the name of it.  Kyoto's softshell crab roll was salty and excessively over-battered.  At first, I blamed myself for soaking my sushi in too much soy sauce but bites after bites; I still tasted salt even when there was no added soy sauce.  Last piece, I separately tried the softshell crab by itself and all I tasted was salt.  The other roll was consisted of several different types of fish folded with a central piece of avocado.  The roll was served deep-fried in a pool of sauce.  A tint of sourness of their sauce was a surprising taste and quite unique.  However, I was not impressed.  The creativity was appreciated but the execution needed some more work.  In addition, I found their menu(s) very confusing.  Kyoto's main menu only lists tappenyaki items.  They also have a separate laminated sushi menu that was given to us to share among eight people?, which only contains a few maki items.  I was very confused when I was also given another different sushi order menu that lists additional nigiri and maki rolls in their own acronyms.  How many hoops do I have to jump through in order to get my sushi ordered?  The acronyms without any descriptions were worthless to be given to the customers.  They were nothing more than scribbles on a piece of paper.  Tappenyaki: 3/5 I can't judge on how good the food tastes but I sure enjoyed their impressive performance.  The flaming volcanic onion, the fire surrounded the teppan, the style and technique of cutting with their aciculate knife in a blink of an eye.  Unfortunately, the show was the highlight of our dining experience at Kyoto restaurant and hopefully the food tasted as good as the performance.  Service: No Star? Dian, our server, despicably greeted us with her agitated facial expression as we asked for our separate checks soon after we were seated.  She scowled as she informed us that there will be a 20% gratuity on our bills because the large number of party.  Everybody gladly agreed and acknowledged.  What remains bothersome was the fact that she was paid 20% of our combined bills to do her job, the job she was already paid to do.  With her attitude and incompetence, she sure did not deserve her tip.  Servers are supposed to be motivated to provide great service with the tip they are receiving at the end of their customers' meals.  I usually don't mind paying for x% gratuity when I am with a big party but this is a perfect example of how one takes advantage of the system.     The night didn't just end with just her grumpiness.  Just out of a friend's curiosity, he asked Dian politely if the restaurant carried Inarizushi.  Dian ignorantly replied, "I do not speak Japanese." I just didn't believe that came out of our server's mouth to a customer that was paying for her atrocious service.  Not only she was ignorant as a waitress at a Japanese restaurant, she could easily come across rude and offensive.   And yes, the rudeness and grouchiness went on the whole night, from the beginning to end.  Parking and etc: 2/5 Kyoto is located in Old Town, Scottsdale, which is probably the only good thing this place has to offer.  It is close to those who are looking forward to the night life in downtown Scottsdale.  They also have their own private parking lot, which is definitely a plus.  However, Kyoto didn't appear to be that busy as we arrived and we still waited for at least half an hour, perhaps more.  By the time we were seated, there were many guys and girls in their mini black dresses sitting on the benches and overflowing the bar area.  Leaving Kyoto with an extreme disappointment, I was surprised how Kyoto is surviving the recession with such poor food and their horrific service.   This restaurant is by far the worst I have tried in Scottsdale.   So, do not waste your time and money because there are many other strong candidates out there in the area.  Overall, Kyto deserves 2/5 with no star in service in my opinion.

ERBHtEXzMRm0wApqy44kQg.text: Best sashimi in the valley hands down! The yellow tail, tuna, salmon, rainbow rolls are all amazing!

K4O6kwZlDO_4yB-RnmSXSA.text: Awesome spot. Food was excellent and prices were very reasonable. The service was stellar and the vibe was welcoming. Highly recommend.

Dv7c5RG_BKuLasiTys-hZA.text: Best table prep I have seen since that place in the Biltmore....love their sushi as well.  This is a downtown Scottsdale attraction and rightly so!  A must see and eat place.  We have gone there every year for my wife's birthday since we have been married, and that's now 9 years.  Always great service, and good food.

P8N4K89fe0B5LXQ2mRrrGA.text: Sushi that won't strain your budget.  Kyoto Japanese has been my go to place for Sushi for 25+ years now.  Lunch is the best value in town.  If you are looking for a swank, place to be seen Sushi joint, then head down the street to one of the other plentiful Japanese / Sushi restaurants.  If you are looking for a place with good sushi at a reasonable price and a friendly staff to serve you, then visit Kyoto.  I did notice that they recently raised prices after 25 years but I think you can still afford it. The price for a Tuna Roll is now a whooping $4.  Come on....you can't beat that and it is always fresh.   The Teppanyaki tables are fun and entertaining.  Oh, almost forgot......A Sake Bomber / Sake with a 22oz Beer is just $6 (at least last time I checked)   If you have not been to Kyoto, be sure to make this one of your upcoming destinations.

2CNVeSVcMREMS64SbzlCmA.text: Outstanding service from Nuko...The rolls and sushi are of great quality considering the price. You must try the point break and the candy cane rolls -They are to die for. You can eat well for two by sharing sushi and rolls for approximately $ 42 + tip. Love this place and think it will become my go to sushi place - They also have the teppanyaki tables which I haven't tried yet.

DiXnLoj7LNgujtCpgPKwkg.text: Some of the best sushi I've ever had. Their dynamite dish is excellent! And so is their fried rice. All in all everything was really good though. Great service as well.

YU3PS13SyYIxctInprufIQ.text: Disappointing all around. We got the new guy, he was nice, but food was cold & bland. Server was below average and restaurant was dated.

WwigQKUG-R-M_UW4LlbOAg.text: So, we sat at a teppanyaki table, which seats like 12 people. So, they don't do separate checks but force you to split it into 4 checks at most. And then, they screw it up by putting some things on one bill and then other things from the same person on a completely different bill. So, if you don't want to spend an hour on your Friday night while people try to figure out who owes who what and trying to get the server to give you a bill that's even slightly close to correct, well, then don't.  The food is fine, about the same as Hon Machi in Chandler, or that place on Elliott in Ahwatukee.  They get two stars because when I pay money, I'm paying for service. Otherwise, I can stay home. There's a reason McDonalds is cheap ... it's because you're not paying for service.

GGGXw3gHVqSFAKlOeLO0bw.text: I never Yelp review but this place is too good not to! First off food is absolutely delicious and don't even get me started on the sake. Service and management are some of the best you will receive. Manager Jesus is not only professional but truly understands the quality of everything to be the best. Would highly recommend for date night or drinks with the boys/girls. Friday tradition has been going strong for 5 weeks now!

photos.caption: Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Rz8NhwZ3es1rMYF9mr1SDw.text: Thank God Kyoto is back.   Been coming here for thirty years.   This is as authentic as it gets.   Had the Masago Nigiri with eggs -- one word exquisite.  Had the Beef Sashimi extra spicy -- so awesome.   The fried rice is the best.  Just the best most authentic Sushi in Az.  Masa started this place long ago, he would be proud that the food is still the best sushi in Az     Try the Saki bombers, they have 12 flavors.  Perfect local joint*****

photos.caption: Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

5gwop86EohS4ksSBm5n7cw.text: I am actually shocked I have never written a review since I have been coming here for 15+ years. I wish I could give more than 5 stars!    There is nothing I don't love here.  From the amazing lunch bento boxes that are very decently priced to the sushi and teppenyaki tables.  Sitting at the sushi bar is the way to go!  All the guys back there are awesome and fun to watch.  Brandon is the best!  Group nights you have to do the teppenyaki tables! Entertaining and good food.  I have had many birthday celebrations growing up at those teppenyaki tables.  I am such a creature of habit here but I can't help it - I love it!!  My go to's: Tako Salad (the spicy ponzu is heaven in a liquid - I want the recipe!), house salad (also obsessed with this dressing - best in town) & Crazy Roll (Shrimp Tempura and Spicy Tuna - you cant go wrong) get it with a side of the spicy ponzu and its a party in your mouth! My dad always gets the salmon kama and its so delicate and perfectly cooked.  Something new to the menu that I now love is the crispy rice with spicy tuna.  I could go on and on.  Just come try for yourself.

MERic7xKv8EHf95lAtL0cw.text: So glad this place reopened.  Great service, amazing food, and fantastic ambiance.  Can't wait to come back with a big group of friends for teppanyaki.

REi1qo-ARBxiMaHB7iPCjQ.text: Overpriced and very odd atmosphere.  Its old and low ceilings.  Location was great and the food was good--just way too high for what you get.

txKjVqrS_1KuOBKaO2HLzg.text: Great time! Food was good, & the service was awesome. I was a bit apprehensive because if all the bad reviews but we went anyways because it's close to home & I'm glad we gave it a chance. Thanks for a wonderful evening.

XSUUKTnDJBFxzapYIr7srQ.text: First of all let me start by saying this was one of the best experiences I've had in old town Scottsdale. Our server Bailey did an outstanding job describing each sashimi to our table.   I ordered the ponyo refresher and I gotta say it was one of the better cocktails Scottsdale has to offer!  Service was amazing bussers came by assuring we had drinks filled and tables clean and our server was very attentive of our needs. Definitely 5 out of 5!!!!  If you come in ask for BAILEY  Thank you Bailey and the Kyoto family for the hospitality we received today !

vaw1QgO2T63ZzT3htEj2Qw.text: This was one of the worst teppenyaki meals we've ever had. The service was bad, the food was poor and the ambience was terrible. We went here with our kids for my husbands birthday and we were sad with the results. They seemed to hurry us through every step of the way. There was nothing authentic about our experience. Very disappointing for all of us. We will not be back.

VMAAvvMpV1IjBA_d46ay5Q.text: WORST SERVICE EVER!!! Do NOT come here. 7 o'clock reservation... would not sit us. You CANNOT order hibachi at the tables. People across from us have waited an hour at their hibachi table and are not getting served. You do not have a server. It's a bunch of young stupid people running around like a chicken with their head cut off but not doing ANYTHING. 10/10 do not recommend. ....saying sorry but not fixing anything. Disgusting. Crossing my fingers the food could be worth the wait... doubt it.

B9bPlEpTlmAsvai59e8MEA.text: So the food was phenomenal. We started with the hot sake and moved to the Japanese whiskey old fashioned  from there we got the pork gyoza, slice of heaven roll and spicy senorita roll. Service was spot on and when it took a while to bring a drink they comped it. Since we couldn't get enough we finished with the fiery dragon roll. We're savory over sweet so no need for desert. We will definitely be back, oh and Paula was such a doll. Super professional and on top of things. Highly recommend!!!

_ADEel076ZKgLVkdsRFHTw.text: Amazing sushi! This place has been around forever and we love it. The sushi chef goes above and beyond

stmLx8HAFViyLpMeuya5fQ.text: Not too impressed with he re-launch. Sashimi arrived before the appetizers, so had to cancel that. Then, it took more than 25 minutes and a reminder that we ordered some rolls too.  Turns out, three sushi chefs were standing idly until our server called them into a huddle to investigate the whereabouts of our yet to be prepared rolls.  I told her to cancel the rest of our order if it hadn't been started yet so we could go to our familiar favorite spot. She disregarded that request.  Maybe it was an off night. But, I'm reluctant to go back even if it is walking distance.

t3ITUrbm4All0uqEJJAT4Q.text: Memories of a favorite restaurant are all that remains. Sashimi platter is overpriced and underwhelming. The sushi bar operating like a food prep counter at a grocery store.  Other folks are more succinct with the recent disappointment here but it's agreed: skip it.

I2DiefZNjQdmP3mUstlqUg.text: I have come home again. Soft open tonight and back to form. I highly recommend the Jaw Dropper roll, the Spirited Away cocktail, & leave at the weeaboo attitude at the door! Don't come in speaking your anime inspired San and Chan, do bring an empty stomach and the desire to have a great time. Drink and be merry for tomorrow is soon upon!

6-V75j2vX1DAM8RFgul3rA.text: I love this place.  The food and the chef were great!  But even with new owner, the restaurant hasn't changed or been updated in 20 years.   It could use an update.   A modern overhaul with the same food would serve this place well. It may be "iconic" for Scottsdale but that beaten down look, won't draw people in.

HQ6yN_-2uJOdiBiN2VdWbg.text: Don't come here service sucks and so does the food the tablet they take online orders with wasn't charged had to wait twenty extra minutes bfor my take out chicken teriyaki had no chicken sushi was ok but hostess attitude was garbage done with this place

rtvlzrk5Cw3H7v5anizaGQ.text: Teppanyaki seating with eight, 4 adults and 4 kids. From reviews, realized restaurant was just re opened a couple weeks ago. Redone dining room with some minor cosmetic updates. Never went to this place prior, but seems like a slight update. Entertainment from "chef" was a bit light. Not as embellished as expected. No real theatrics and did not make fried rice at table, came from kitchen in bowl. Seemed a bit out of sequence, salad and soup at same time, then shrimp app, vegetables, then seafood, then proteins. No ice cream at end, we may be spoiled at the  restaurant we go to at home. Food was all ok, nothing overly memorable.

cIiTIuThtYdVkGKYBxymIw.text: Service is amazing! Food? Delicious! Nice place. Will definitely come back to have my birthday here! Sooooo good!

u3z5Jn1qCU5o-ra4EZyUQA.text: One star for the most terrible service in recent memory.  Our server "DK" was outright rude and horrible, and outright ignored us when she wasn't making us uncomfortable.   As a former waitress of 14 years, I have the utmost respect, patience and tolerance for my former bretheren - but this woman needs to go.  BAD DK!  Otherwise, our Teppiniyaki (sp?) chef was wonderful, the food was delicious and fresh and a solid four stars.  I have been going to Kyoto since 1995 and it remains a fun and festive place with very reasonable prices.  Too bad it was ruined this time by DK!   DK needs a different job, more suited to her personallity, like euthanizing kittens or something.

E_KUk0VXGe_rUKVgX1hciQ.text: It's been a while. Ok..... Still impressed with the pricing. Affordable for sure. I like the re model. Thought they were building a patio, but maybe not. New windows were cool. Not sure how to describe the service. Server, blah and I mean pretty blah. Doesn't mean she did a bad job. Just blah. Can Kyoto invest in server uniforms? We still had a good time. Will be back. Hope they will take a hard look at the service that they provide.

sLJ5dEltdP37FEaETjEuUg.text: One of my favorite spots to go to for good, cheap, and (usually) fast sushi. I usually always sit at the sushi bar, because this place can get busy at there regular tables. Usually when I'm in the mood for sushi, I go to this place. I love everything about it, the only couple times I havent enjoyed my sushi were when we had gotten a couple special rolls, which I can't even remember the name of those since they were so forgettable. Service is great, and our drinks are replenished rather quickly. My fiance and I can become stuffed with sushi for about $20 for the both of us.

r_tYun7eXkk6Z4uNUyzhVw.text: Every time I've been here the food has been excellent! Whenever family comes into town and we can't think of a place to go Kyoto always comes up because it never disappoints! The entrees are a decent portion, we always split them cause unless you're starving you won't be able to finish it on your own. I do have to say though that every time we've gone we've only ever done the teppanyaki so I don't know what their bento is like but I can't imagine it being bad. Def go with a cool group and enjoy the show!

JnXHQD3BjyEhlMfyFfj5bA.text: This is the best kept lunch secret in town!!! meets all my criteria.  good food, big portions and cheap.  Had California rolls, Teriyaki chicken with a salad.  It was all great!

HRoZq_iY0P3-tXyLCZXS_g.text: Best sushi I've found in the desert. It's almost a shame to give it 5 stars because it's already too busy.  The sashimi pieces are huge, service has always been great and the saki-bomb setup for $4 is a steal.  I've always sat at the bar so I can't speak about the tapanyaki tables.  Then again, who would want to sit at one of those anyway?  I'll take mine raw.

5oGXq25YgCwX7ZPFk3Ve5g.text: I'm a regular here. I always enjoy the crab rolls and of course the filet..... Mmmmm melt in your mouth pieces. Consistenly good ****

U3L2oFA_2Xgjmnvs2fzTPA.text: I go a few times a week for lunch, which is very inexpensive.  For $3.75 you get a nice assortment of tempura vegetables and fish, small salad, and a little ball of rice.  It's just the right amount of food for lunch and you absolutely cannot find anything cheaper nearby.

r0Lp8ACBY3HRnqQuo0PIAg.text: My wife and I love this place.  It's our favorite sushi.  Yes, it is always packed (you are a tool if you haven't figured out to get there before 7:30p for dinner), and most of it is typical N. Scottsdale kids who are at the bar and acting like idiots.  The sushi is priced cheap for Scottsdale and always tastes great, never a problem with "catching" anything, like another reviewer said, and we've been here 6 - 7 times at least.  Lunch is a really good deal too.  Never tried the grill but always looks great.

qnPBGofFpO4hu_XRMXrkEA.text: go for the screamin lunch menu!  all the usual fare for $3.50 and up.  plus it's in a nice area and the decor is pleasant.  you can get the same stuff in a styrofoam bowl at those other places but why not eat it out of a bento box and look stylish at the same time?  not earth shattering but then again, it won't cost you and arm and a leg...

bajy5NmLlUtnD086it7gdA.text: This place used to be my favorite sushi place when I first started going about 9 years ago. As the years go by, the quality, freshness, and taste of the food has failed to please. I used to recommend this place to friends and visitors, but now I can't even get myself to go in there for a meal.

1hQ5rUfWjiM5QKB4uDgEhg.text: Alright, lets set a few things straight. My experience equates to a three, yes, however I was almost tempted to give it a 4, simply to offset some of the ridiculously unjustified one or two star reviews I've read below.   *To complain about the tuna in a spicy tuna roll being mashed, because it ruins the texture and the flavor of the tuna? Sincerely, if its texture and integrity of tuna flavor that your looking for perhaps you shouldn't be eating a roll where traditionally, you "mash" the tuna, adding a slew of "spicy" seasonings into it? Try the sashimi perhaps? Just a thought.  *To give a restaurant a 2star rating because they didn't provide noodles like Benihana? Also might be an unfair comparison.   *Another 2 star rating because they didnt like the hostess stand being by the door? I'm not even sure I understand this complaint.  Anyhow, here goes my own personal experience.  Promptly greeted and as the restaurant was full, even on an off night, were seated at the sushi bar, which is fine, because its where we wanted to go anyhow. Ordered a cocktail from their slightly pedestrian bar offerings. A little surprised that the edamame wasn't complimentary, but didn't mind too much since, one - i think this might be a Scottsdale thing - and two, both it and the soup, as many people have stated, were very inexpensive. Ordered sushi, and a few tidbits from the kitchen, Server was nice, friendly and as attentive as could have been expected as busy as she was. Sushi was slightly undersized in portions (and yes, even for classic Japanese standards) but when the bill came, it reflected the size fittingly, leaving no thoughts as to it being over-priced. Sushi Chef (not the owner.) was skilled but seemed either lacking in rapport with the guests, or just too busy to show some sense of personality.*shrug, but i suppose as long as he gets the job done, thats all that matters. Experience was altogether pleasing, but did seem as if there was always a ying to the yang to consistently make the 4 star experience back to a 3.   PROS: *Pleasant server               *Good sushi, quality fish, nice cuts.               *Undersized portions but also very reasonable price tags  CONS:   *Fairly pedestrian bar and sake selections.                   Bar i can forgive, but wish the sake selection was a little                   more interesting.                  *No little freebies that you see in some other Japanese                   restaurants. Edamame, Soup, even the rice, yep..paid for.                 * No desserts available whatsoever. Nada, Zip Zilch.  You know what? I AM going to give it a 4, because if the pricing, quality and service for lunch is anything like dinner, I'm still a fan and ill definitely be trying this place again. (Also, like i said to help offset some of what I think are those unfair one and two star reviews.) True, nothing blew me away about the experience...but definitely nothing so overwhelming  bad to deserve a 1 or 2 star review. Next time I'm craving sushi, Kyoto will work just fine. Hope this helps!

kTGsGamJmsvWx2az4CH7WA.text: Great sushi for a very reasonable price, my friends and I love going here. Although on the weekends the wait can be very long and the small bar overfilled with patrons. The host could be a bit more friendly, but we've been willing to overlook that for the food.

PI0jpV0MzThk4-j-YRNYwA.text: I must confess i have only been here for Lunch, but it is one of the best deals in town for Lunch.  My friend and i just ate there and had Chicken teriyaki, white rice, salad, 2 sushi rolls and a squid salad and only paid $13 each...I mean c'mon-that's pretty hard to beat.  Just the Chicken w rice and salad is $3.50 and it's so filing and delicious! Would recommend it to anyone who likes a filling tasty meal for a cheap price.

fbdS4NN7oUlty3_pGHKI3w.text: Went here for a girlfriend's Bachelorette weekend - So fun!  But then again, we'd have fun at a gas station.  It was about 100 degrees out at night - and there were many a dude sportin' fancy, expensive convertibles driving by (possibly hoping to pick up a drunk bachelorette?) - parts of Scottsdale ooze money.  Good food & drinks.

8Npx1O4zcyH57tdi53tVkA.text: Really?  Teriyaki Chicken with a side salad and rice for $3.50?  Oh, and its good?  Seriously?  I was amazed at how cheap their lunch specials are and even more amazed that it was actually quite good.  The chicken was soft moist white meat with a tasty teriyaki sauce and mushrooms.  I really enjoyed the sauce, because it wasn't sickeningly sweet or heavy.  The salad was as simple as they come... just some iceberg lettuce with a surprisingly flavorful dressing.  I am not sure what the dressing was made of, but my best guess is some combination of peanut, soy and ginger.  Very tasty!  It was really the perfect amount of food for the lunch hour.  I walked away full and satisfied, but not so full that I had to fight the post-lunch food coma.

5sXQ7oALz7vpudzP0AXDLQ.text: I have been a patron of Kyoto for 15 years, in fact went on a really bad date there when I was 21.  Even though the date was painfully bad it didn't ruin my taste for Kyoto.  Now I love sushi and have been to many places in town so I have much to compare it to.  But the reason I come here more than any other place is I can enjoy a great sashimi lunch for less than $10 dollars or come have dinner plus drinks for around $25.  That makes me and my wallet very happy.  I walk to it from work and have lunch usually once a week. Have taken 3 of my stylist who have never been there before and turned them in to Kyoto fans.  The service is great, really friendly and I like that they recognize me always asking "how's business?  Good to see you again!"  It is another place here in old town that make me feel like I am not lost in the tourist shuffle.

DhsU_SIrOwst6P7klyXp5g.text: I like this place. It's a fun atmosphere, the bartender is really friendly and fun. The shots 'banana cum suckers' are soooo good.

xKNwlCrpLUr_itrvROhAhg.text: Best sushi in town!  It is my favorite lunch spot because their lunch specials are incredibly cheap and their sushi is always so fresh.  I've been coming here over 10 years and the atmosphere is the same.  We take friends that are from out of town here for sushi and teppanyaki (in the evenings).  Best place ever!

KWHVSMFdCiNjz4YF9MBbQQ.text: Crowded, pushy, noisey unimaginative.  Do not bother.

LtUqMRMJVgxHjidsdSGPLA.text: My mom and I were drawn in by the reasonably priced lunch menu and convenient location- but we quickly discovered that the reasonable menu equated terrible food.  The lunch menu is priced so reasonably ($5-$8 for a complete bento box) that I worried about the quality of the food as we placed our order.  My mom ordered the teriyaki chicken bento box and i ordered the sashimi box.  Neither of us liked the salad dressing (too much ginger), although people who like ginger will probably enjoy it.  I literally had to spit out my first bite of sashimi (tuna).  It was the most fishy and rough piece of fish I've ever tasted.  It was absolutely atrocious and the flavor remained in my mouth long after i spit it out.  After that first bite, I decided against trying the other sashimi out of concern that I would get sick.  My mom's chicken was also terrible- she described it as tough and over cooked.  We politely told the waitress (an older lady, possibly the owner) that we were both unable to eat our meals.  She rudely informed me that the fish was fresh and there was nothing wrong with it.  (note: if that is what they consider fresh fish, then their standards are VERY low).  I apologized and told her that I was unable to eat it.  She grabbed the plate away, but refused to take my mother's food (stating that there was nothing wrong with the chicken).  Another waitress came by and we explained the situation to her.  She was very nice and apologized, and my mom and I left the restaurant.  The food was so atrocious that we literally left without eating!

roB-xFfvtfdk7xZbdTSB6g.text: Kyoto does a good job of doing what it does.  That being said, if you've been to one Kyoto, you've been to them all.    Tepanaki (you know what I'm trying to spell here dont you?) tables, the Japanese dude lighting onion towers on fire on the table in front of you...taking pictures to put on your birthday mug...yes, its all the same.  But its all good.  Delicious actually.  Never a bad meal have I eaten at Kyoto.    Never have I not waited in a line as long as the nile either.  "But I have reservations!"  They dont care.  Tell Lisa-Lipgloss to hurry her sweet cheeks up because they wont seat any of you until shes there.  Pony up to the bar for some savory (and surprisingly super cheap) saki bombs while you wait, and you'll forget you actually came to eat.  If you still have an urge to eat, do it right and get both sushi and a tepan-cooked meal...you'll be impressed and its not overpriced, you get a ton of food.  Bring your appetite, patience and your valet money and roll through Kyoto...the annoyances are worth your weight in sushi.

x-rmAAY4QM9H-eOBcUfQ6Q.text: Kyoto is by far my favorite place to eat sushi in Scottsdale. The atmosphere feels authentic, the prices are great, and the staff is top notch. One of the best places to throw a birthday party, have a fun date, or just hang out with some friends. Reserve a table for some cooked Japanese food and be witness to a show then enjoy a very tasty treat. Hang out in the bar and get served by a friendly bar tender who will give you advice for the rest of your evening. Can't wait for my next time.

FADvQC3isSmVelHDH9KhEA.text: I have been a satisfied customer of Kyoto for over 15 years.  It is the first place I have tried sushi & I have taken many sushi virgins there to pop their cherry.  Sushi is fabulous & a great price.  The Dynamite is absolutely to die for.    This is a place I've celebrated milestone bithdays, dates, many a great Saturday night.  It is a place I always want to come back to.

nzyAK7ndt-bPeb0KBWThqQ.text: I am so done with this place, it is truly a dump. The coworkers love it for some reason and I think it's mostly the lunch prices. You get what you pay for. Dust on the windowsills. The dishes they serve the sushi on look like they fished them from a dumpster.  I've tried the sushi, the teppan, and the bento style lunches. All were unremarkable. If all you care about is a cheap lunch, by all means go here. I will not be returning.

kTNDxvfAFKJQePWZGKH4Yw.text: Really cheap and fresh sashimi that is served in a space that resembles the trailer that Budd lived in from the Quentin Tarantino's "Kill Bill Vol.2". Good selection of fresh fish coupled with the typical variety of sushi rolls that most people a accustomed to. Nothing too special about Kyoto but it's a great place to pop into and get your sushi fix for a low price.

5WGVM3kafjTQ5vQeDbHWLg.text: For the price this place is awesome.  The service you may find a bit slow, but if your not a scottsdale brat, and dont expect someone else to wipe your ass for you, you will love this place.  The lunch prices are unreal, and I've taken my kids here for there birthday at the teppanyaki tables - which we all loved.  The sushi is better than Ra for the price in my opinion.  So let me say again if you're not a snobby scottsdale brat you will indeed love this place.

UDUBylRyIcbWLYVjWWksPQ.text: Lunch for under $4.00?  You bet you.  Super cheap lunch from 11-2pm tues-sunday.  I usually get out of there with a Bento box with Chicken, rice, salad, and slices of oranges for $3.75 and a Tuna Roll for $3.50,  Super cheap!!  I heard dinner is exquisite.

GGXjGYPkkr3-rvYgNObkAw.text: Cons: -Service SUCKS (for lack of a better word) so bad during lunch hours. There's a waitress who always works there during lunch hours who's so spacey that she will never see you if you need her attention. Refilling drinks is not apart of her job description either, I'm guessing. Kyoto (whether it be the servers or the people preparing the food) gets our order wrong about 80% of the time. -Food is a hit or miss thing. Some of their stuff is heavenly good, and some of it tastes like sewage. Trying asking for a recommendation from someone. -You need reservations if you go there on a weekend night, guaranteed.  Pros: -Go during lunch hours! The prices are insanely great! You can get a whole bento box with sashimi for around or less then $5! Considering the usual price of sashimi combos, this is the best deal I've seen ever. -The sashimi (which encompasses most of what I've had there anyway) is also extremely fresh and the servings are relatively generous.  Overall: Service is below average, but the sushi is high quality for a great price.

PeHBuyA27KS-CZh1SU_gkg.text: Good quality for the price. The food tastes very well like other people reviewed. It wasn't like real Japanese style, but it is still okay to have a decent meal in the casual atmosphere.

XnG6wKjhfnxlfJvxCmJzgg.text: Fish was fresh-new sushi eater loved the candy cane roll!  Friends found the having to write the order ourselves weird.

ttBvlZH31hbGl4etQdO0Lg.text: Stumbled upon this place around dinner time and decided to give it a try. Bad decision.  I will first give you the worst. My fiance had explosive diarrhea all night after eating here. He ordered Ichi Roll.  I wish I had read the review on this restaurant then I would have avoided this place. The other reviewer has described this Ichi Roll. I completely agree. Gross. In addition to what he described, this roll is huge, the size of a burger patti! No roll should be so big that you can't fit in your mouth. That just goes to show the chef does not know Japanese cuisine.  I ordered dragon roll, which is eel and avocado. Overall flavor is okay but the texture of the fish is mushier than usual that it makes me think perhaps it's not fresh.  The green tea. Watered down. Not much flavor.  Edamame. Tasted like store bought Edamame, but it's the kind that's overstocked and about to expire. You get the Idea.  So, will I come back to this restaurant? You tell me.

eH8FKef7IxEp-R7gqmv5ag.text: I eat lunch here 3-4 times a month. The prices for their lunch specials are fantastic. I usually get a chicken teriyaki bowl, along with a sushi roll, and the total is about $7. I've had a variety of their sushi, and it's all been great.

nchFFF1i40cUa-A8wtgkwg.text: I have been to Kyoto about 3-4 times in the past 7 years.  I still hasn't changed a bit since the first time I went there when I was fifteen!  I always eat at the grills.  I love places with the tepanaki (I dont know how to spell it) grills.  I have been to many many places like this and Kyoto is just ok.  This place needs some serious redecorating.  It looks like the place is stuck in the 1970's.  The food is good though.  Last time our grill cook was really bad and was droping things all over the place but hey everyone has an off day sometimes.  I may go here again just because its so close to my home but otherwise I've had better.

p0sz6VGftI5H7dSX6Ax1Jw.text: The sushi is just barely above average.  The service from the wait staff is good, but the sushi chefs themselves border on rude.  Super inexpensive.  If you need a sushi fix, don't care about the service, and are poor, then this is for you.

Es27DTgu5FBD3oyr-zxuZg.text: well..... yea ...  this is scottsdale original sushi bar that has been awarded for the best sushi for more than 16 yrs? reallly? wait a second.. we ARE in arizona, so hmm, mebe the standards are quite different ...   i, for one, was not thrilled ...  must say the sushi was quite ginormous but it sure didn't taste all that yummy and fresh... an average sushi ranged from $4 and up but honestly, if i was living in scottsdale, i would TOTALLY come for lunch... where can you find a deal for less than $5? whether you get chicken teriyaki/cutlet or whatever it was literally $3.50. YES! for lunch!!!  $3.50 for lunch! so unheard of! +1 for that  dinner?  an average dinner is $20/up... SO not worth it...   and who puts big chunky mushrooms in miso soup and sadly, there wasn't a SINGLE TOFU! is it just me or is that simply weird?

KFH1iU-17z0MwMVGU_vjgQ.text: i eat a lot of sushi and teppan. this is one of, if not the best sushi/teppanyaki joint in phx.  the sushi is meaty and delicious and well-priced. not fishy tasting at all ("fishy" means "not fresh"). the only negative is their selection is lacking a bit.  the teppanyaki may be the best of any places i have been to. soup and salad come with the meal. the soup is not miso soup and i dont really care for it. the salad on the other hand . . . best citrus-ginger dressing of any japanese restaurant. the filet is seriously like butter. only thing is, there is no filet + scallops combo -- you have to get the ny strip to get the combo. i suppose you can ask but i didnt. the only other negative is that they do not make the fried rice at your table, they just bring you a bowl of it from the kitchen. come on, thats part of the draw of teppan!  also, their lunch is amazing! for less than $4, you get a box lunch with entree/meat, salad, rice and orange slices. best deal in scottsdale. wish i still worked across the street.

TLl79KIrEhjDr6u6rsoLhQ.text: Best sushi in Old Town.  A part of me does not want to give Kyoto great reviews in fear that it'll take me a few more minutes to get my sushi fix.  For the first 2 years living in Old Town I thought this place was closed down.  The shutters are always closed and looks dark in the outside but I'm very happy to find it open.  I've only had the sushi and not the tepenyaki.  Like what others said, prices are very good for Old Town and quality is good.  It's 10,000 times better than Ra.  Granted the atmosphere isn't hip but you're there for the sushi, right?  If you want atmosphere go to Ra.

EGnB85fyaHl2Ycx4z4UY_Q.text: There is something about Yelp that compels me to tell the truth, the whole truth and nothing but the truth, so help me God.  So before I get to the bad, I'll tell you about the good. Kyoto is so fun.  I've been going there for years and it's pretty much a guaranteed good time- especially if you sit at a cooking table.  Keep in mind that the cooking tables really fill up quickly, so if you're looking to get one for a larger party for a Friday or Saturday night, you definitely need to get that reservation in early on in the week. Smaller parties can usually be squeezed in to the tables without thaaat long of a wait.    The environment is always lively at Kyoto- maybe it's the sake...I don't really know. But this is definitely not the spot for a quiet, romantic dinner.  People are always yelling, laughing and talking very loudly here and it's often the scene for birthday and graduation celebrations.  In fact, when it's your birthday, they bring out something I can only describe as a washcloth shaped weener with a cherry on top. They also sing and give you a coffee mug that has pictures of sushi all around it.    I got this mug a few years ago and after a few shots, found it so funny that I became absolutely determined not to lose it during the night ahead of me. I somehow (and I say this with great pride) kept that mug in my bag the whole night and still have it today.    I think the food is good at Kyoto too and the sushi is pretty decent.  But the fried rice is what dreams are made of.  Try it and you'll know what I mean. My best friend and I used to go to Kyoto some nights before we went out and sit at the bar with a drink in one hand and a bowl of fried rice in the other. Forget the cooking tables- that's all we needed.   Now I have to end this review on a bad note, but keep in mind that although it took me about a year to return after the 'incident,' I still did return nonetheless and still go to Kyoto on occasion.  This happened probably five years ago, but I will never forget it. My friend and I ordered sake and were pouring it into the little sake glass when we noticed something black had poured out with it.  A horrified little peak into the glass revealed it was a large, hideous roach! AAAAARGH. It still freaks me out. The glass was thrown and we made quite a scene, but upon telling the bartender, the only response he gave back to us was "well, was it alive?" DOES IT MATTER?   He comped us two gin and tonics and sent us on our way and that was that.  I know from working in the service industry that all restaurants and clubs have roaches, it's just a fact of life. You can do your best to maintain it, but those little bastards keep on coming. I don't completely blame Kyoto or think the place is infested with roaches but it still was a little traumatizing for someone that is deathly afraid of those hideous monsters.  It took me awhile to return, but I still go, I just won't order the sake. If you do, please do me a favor and look in the little sake bottle before you pour it.

qZTOQsVmyfRGFtQZTgPGzQ.text: My life has never been the same since Ayako of Tokyo located at the Biltmore Fashion Park was shut down. However, Kyoto of Scottsdale has to be the next best thing for Sushi and Saki B's. While the trendy "A Crowds" are dumping loads of cash on high priced drinks, mediocre sushi and snobby service, I am stuffing my face silly at Kyoto. Don't expect fancy frills here just damn good and inexpensive eats.  Itadakimasu

DbFuinMXbJyMf_ws_xjTyg.text: Entertaining and good food Sapporo sake bombers were great and the ice cream treats were amazing.

dTnsKpzzanSoACq4R9Orrw.text: Great lunch specials. Bento box comes with soup, salad, edamame, and white rice in addition to your entree choice. I opted to add 1/2 California roll for $3.50 extra, roll was well made with fresh ingredients. Pricing was on par with other sushi places at lunch. Next time I would try the ramen, it looked appetizing.

0AZUOdzZG5lRAXZ_mKss0Q.text: Table chef, does great show, really likes "fire". Prices in par with other similar style places. Service was great, only complaint is WAY to much garlic!  Chef put liquid garlic concoction on EVERYTHING!

PBoBblkAZkvxZk5FSkaezw.text: The best Teppanyaki we've ever had.   The staff was great.  They all ran their legs off.  We had a great time!  Highly recommend!

g4uQblcB9onCDdjJJhGa8Q.text: I am so impressed with this place! Came to old town for breakfast but every place had a ridiculous wait. We noticed that Kyoto was open and they had a sign that said they served breakfast. We decided to give it a shot and we are so glad we did. So good and great prices!

photos.caption: Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

oQjGtTnUSUf-UTb7KDK8ZA.text: We went for hibachi.  The wait to be seated was short however the was an hour wait for the chef to come to our table and cook.    I felt bad for him being the only chef and an almost full restaurant.   He did a great job with cooking and very good about accommodating my request for no extra salt and very light on the soy sauce.  Next time we will think twice whe we see a sign posted on door for chefs needed.

Uo5iZhYvIhTve9qNLUfa3A.text: This place is a hidden gem in old town. My friend who really knows old town took me. We both had bento boxes for lunch. They run about 10-14 and are large and delicious. They come with miso soup, Japanese rice, and a delicious little salad. I had the pork tonkatsu and my friend had the shrimp and vege tempura. Both were beyond delicious! Service was good our tea was refilled several times.  I haven't had Japanese food since I moved here! I was so happy to find a great place so close to me. I really enjoyed and will be back!

Wl84u7sFQu1i8NVd89nxug.text: The Sausage Gravy and Biscuits with Eggs was fire! I could tell the pepper is freshly grounded from whole black pepper, not pepper from a shaker. The gravy was rich with buttermilk. Everything was dope they just started breakfast a month ago. Highly recommend to check out breakfast.

KIddFKWgupKNLNitDgdKUQ.text: Love bringing friends here for a party.  The teppanyaki style cooking is amazing and fun to watch, the chefs do a great job entertaining and interacting with customers.  It's not inexpensive and getting a little run down but last time I was there but it's still on my list of favorites.

RTBGbgFPFKrqu1s6EGl_ww.text: Absolutely loved this place! Staff is super friendly and management is great. Loved the food and the vibe of Kyoto. My boyfriend is not a fan of sushi but there were plenty of items he enjoyed off the menu. Will definitely return!

Xj-Inmc3nT4vcRJo-oijqw.text: I'm glad I can finally write a review for this place. I've been a customer since 2013 and I was so happy to hear they opened again! The lunch specials are amazing. Generous portions, great variety, tastes delicious and the prices are the best in all of old town.  If you work, live, or happen to be in the area, do yourself a favor and come here for lunch! If you're having dinner plans, they have Teppanyaki tables as well so you can enjoy the show and great food.  Sushi selection is also quite awesome and the staff is always friendly. I only have amazing things to say about this place over the years. Thanks to Kyoto for being around!

LsOlo2yruTandpa_bRLKvg.text: My husband and I just walked out and were really disappointed with the quality of the fish. We actually honeymooned here 14 yrs ago and fell in love with Kyoto then. It was the first time that we had a meal and walked out in 30 mins. Do not come here!

RCXwGdLtl3Av8x1P3EWnKw.text: Good list of sushi rolls on happy hour, and good specials on drinks. The atmosphere was quite dead, but we got great service and loved our food.

IQSAWkcu7APeFxLaROYctw.text: Worse sushi we've ever eaten . I should have known when there was no one in the restaurant when we arrived.  This used to be one of my favorites but obviously there was a new ownership and not bought by anyone who is Asian!!

myV0LNWh1srSk9UA9IrYlQ.text: Food was just okay and expensive! Service was crap. Stood there for 30 minutes after our reservation time when the manager said it would be at most 5 minutes. Server wasn't good and neither was the teppan chef. Go somewhere else.

1Nwu9ajB9I0wvHYhQGiuRA.text: Extremely disappointed by the service and the management. We were there with a party of 18 for a birthday celebration and two veterans on Veterans Day. We sat for an hour and 30 minutes before we got drinks. What a joke! When I approached the manager he said he would see what was going on. Shortly after the chefs arrived to prepare our meal. I thought things were course corrected.  But then... We never got our soup and when asked about it the staff said sorry- we will take care of it. They never did. When we finished our meal we sat for 45 mins waiting for the birthday celebration. I had to find the manager again to find out what was going on. Again... he said he'd figure it out...but then We literally had a server and another staff member come to a table of 18 to sing. Pathetic!! Of course - another 20 mins for a check. As we were walking out there was another table with a birthday celebration. They had 5 staff members and the coward restaurant manager singing for them. As we left the restaurant I waited for the manager at the front..his response to the poor service - NOTHING! Not a word. 100% lack of accountability!!! $1000 check and not even an "I'm sorry"! Inexcusable!!! Save yourself the disappointment... don't drop a dine in this establishment. Btw- during all of this I made two trips to the bar to get drinks for the whole table when we had a server!!! Yes - I am a former food server. I know what is acceptable and what is inexcusable. This was simply inexcusable!

U981CkBArgZDGnb8MqZfXA.text: Great service, great food, greater prices. I always sit at the sushi bar and they've remembered me since my first time in. 5/5!

NwC31oKDWjTMkr7hQh76Eg.text: If you want to sit around with absolutely no attention at all, while you die of thirst, then this is the place for you. I will never come back to this overrated establishment. Find any place else.

KCno4Hxt5bQk6NJsIV24hA.text: If you are going here for sushi, please don't. Absolutely terrible, no flavor, prepared incorrectly, just disappointing.

2S90BbclEQWprZNdHSPUEQ.text: We went for teppanyaki for my friend's birthday, and both the food and service were very good!

f1miMt2tGey0LkaOFhZ5KA.text: Went here for my bday last night and the food was just as good as it was before they closed for a while. The updates look nice and clean. Everyone from the hostess to the chef was super friendly. Sad to see the lunch prices went up but I doubt that'll stop me from going.

koKe_7qGpEU3eoAF6tIKMw.text: Love Love Love Kyoto Lunch! Consistently Excellent! Have been going there for years. Keep up the great job Kyoto Japanese Restaurant .

Fv1ZYeOaPGPKVYuIcxs75A.text: We had a huge birthday party here for a friend. We took up the entire right side of the restaurant. The plumb wine was great. I had the sashimi and a roll and i regret it. I ate wayyy too much.   This place is pretty nice but I like some other options in the area a little better. There are a lot of sushi options in the scottsdale area. The best sushi place I had in the valley had to be near Ahwatukee.

WnmFjk6BeBHrLXNQI1BBbQ.text: The staff took 10 minutes to get my friend and I menus and water. The sushi staff completely forgot about our order 30 min after getting salads and the appetizer. This place seems to be running in disarray.

E26sF3vAMwkEQ5iB3K6HFA.text: best teppanyaki in town! also really great customer service.

y0qBheMjnMDoUwoO4RGKGw.text: One of my favorite spots in in town. The good it's always good and the service is tops. I recommend the salmon volcano roll if you are on a date. She will be impressed when that comes out. The parking has valet do that's another plus for dates. Me and my girlfriend did the teppan so I recommend that cause the chefs are really skilled and the food is delicious. The price for this place is very reasonable since you are in Scottsdale. Guys if you need a place to go and want to impress your date go here.
