RgJPvuImz5IKOZMKAWXO3A.text: Sushi was FANTASTIC. Our server, Hector, was an awesome guy, very helpful, very willing to accommodate. We got all sorts of rolls, and each one was better than the last. The Alaska roll came with lemon slices on it, which was my favorite touch. What a place!

GbQbj12C-cYN560U5Ms1oQ.text: Economical but only so-so sushi...  I had tried Kyoto years ago and found it pretty disappointing in terms of sushi quality, but since it has remained open, I decided to give it another try in case I had simply had a poor initial experience.  I have now tried it twice in two weeks, and it still is a generally disappointing experience. While the lunch menu prices are great, the sashimi quality remains off. The first week it just tasted bland, and the second week is was bland, overly wet and spongy in texture to the point that I was slightly nervous about eating it.  Both times I had the Sashimi lunch special which is nicely priced. Each time, my miso soup was barely warm, and not very flavorful.  The first week I also had a spicy tuna hand roll, which was substantial in size, but totally lacking flavor and spice. The tuna preparation was generally incorrect.  Service was just ok, and both times my server failed to check back with me after delivering my food to be sure it was ok.   Perhaps the cooked dishes are a better choice.

NKTj2VSbfjC5kQ7uzL1d-g.text: Amazing presentation and accuracy with taste. Great sushi in Scottsdale. The Chef came out multiple times to make sure we were taken care of.

b5pDyPhRc14jRBnHMqow4A.text: The volcano salmon roll and dynamite roll are great. Everything else is amazing too. Always a favorite place at downtown Scottsdale.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Volcano salmon roll

50RkpBHLsB9BQVbrhhYAVg.text: Probably wouldn't return. We were pleasantly surprised on Saturday night when we called and the had Teppanyaki table available for 2 at 8 pm (only 1 hour from when I called). When we arrived at 745 we gave our name and the hostess looked for us and clearly didn't find our name but said "we will seat you closer to your reservation". We grabbed drinks at the bar... bartender was fun, talkative, and never let our drinks get low. The bar area was very crowded and not comfortable area to sit long term. At 830 the hostess came to get us and it was much more apparent they hadn't written down our reservation as they attempted to sit us with a full table in the corner up against a bookshelf. The hostess realized this was not going to work and sat us solo at a grill. We then waited until 940 for our chef to come to us. The show was half as exciting as everyone around us. My filet was over cooked and the other food was sub par.

WKgoTLKTsUNCVOZsmWGebA.text: Best teppanyaki place. All the food is deli and the cooks are always friendly. Filet mognon and shrimp are in my opinion the best.

9S6PZxqAAzAA1-DmYifLuw.text: Sashimis were not fresh and warm, yes, WARM! $14 tuna toro lacked any flavors. Sea urchins taste like chemicals, and not fresh either. Nigiri rice were warm and hard so it's probably from the day before. Steak tataki were overcooked. A good place to get cheap lunch but not for good sashimi. Service was sub par. Will never come back.

CEA53tsd6X13QyAq9z2Q1g.text: The food is very good, but service is horrible. The waitress was concerned on carrying a conversation with the cook, than serving us.

LvNYLB1xfB59pPKJbV2okw.text: Don't expect perfection or anything too fancy at Kyoto. It's a hidden right in the heart of Old Town Scottsdale. Their sushi is decent and well priced for what you get. This is our very casual go to with friends when we don't want to drive up to Sakana. Hot saki (bombers) come free with beer - potentially a great spot to get a nice buzz before a night out in Old Town.

NcxwUlokovR8D4ByDRYaNw.text: The flavor of the food was alright but somewhat bland. The guy who made our food at the table was very nice but there was some miscommunication with our order.  We thought they would cook the fried rice in front of us so we paid extra, and then they just brought it to us in a bowl. So nobody ate the rice we paid extra for because it wasn't special...or what we expected.   Overall, probably would not return with my family.

oxENv1Fix1o4sLkzhBjCCA.text: They say Sushi bars are more about the decor and the swag than the food and boy did this lovely place in old town Scottsdale live up to the expectation! Our itamae (chef) was very pleasant and delightful. He kept cracking jokes whilst showing excellent skills with the fork and the slotted spoon. The menus is good with decent prices. We had 2 rolls, 2 chicken entrees and 3 drinks for $45. I felt the food was mediocre but I'd overlook that in lieu of the wholesome experience, plus I am not a huge fan of sushi anyway. All in all, it was an awesome experience and I would recommend this as a must try for a night of dining fun!

photos.caption: Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Onion Volcano

68YkjLICvcMsXo5ec2MYmQ.text: This place is a treasure in Old Town Scottsdale! Consider yourself lucky if you need a cheap lunch in Scottsdale because this is as good as it gets!   I LOVE their sushi and lunch specials. $3.95 for a full chicken terriyaki lunch, with salad!! I guess they don't believe in inflation? These prices cannot be found anywhere else...ESPECIALLY NOT in old town.   Their rolls are unbelievably cheap too! I had an order of oysters one day and it was...AMAZING! Once again...cheap oysters that are fresh and served on a plate of ice. What more can you ask for?

photos.caption: Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

1cA2EII6mJRAgbV7zHxRXg.text: Eh? Not impressed, I came Years ago and comparing quality I can see standards are fleeting.   I ordered 3 sushi rolls and I can say im not impressed, all came out promptly however the third was an eel  variety that actually had bones in it. After my first bite and attempt to save my esophagus I was turned off and couldn't finish anything..  For being 8-9 on a Friday I was disappointed there we're more empty tables than not..  Saving grace saki comes with every beer? Yes please!! This may have been my last horrah (sp?)  For Scottsdale dining for some time..

34eZIHJFPE2gpnPxrLnHag.text: Best sushi in old town Scottsdale. Great food and prices are reasonable. Service is super friendly. Atmosphere is great and they have two different bars. Went in for dinner and we had six rolls between two people which was plenty of food. Fish is fresh and delicious. Great for families or a meal with a group.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

VoDM6UnSOANlkIacWHAKXw.text: * Kyoto * - This used to be our "go-to" sushi place when we were in College.  Literally a sushi roll stuffed with quality fish was $2.99.  Fast forward 20 years and; as expected, the prices have grown with inflation significantly.  The quality is still decent, but lacks imagination.  I am not sure if that is good or bad.  Many sushi restaurants are getting a little to creative for my liking.  I prefer standards like "Maki, Sashimi or Hand Rolls".  Kyoto is a good time and should be experienced at least once.  The bar gets quite crowded and they also do Teppanyaki which is very popular.  So, if you want to avoid the crowds, hit them up for lunch; or, dinner Sunday - Wednesday.  They are located right in the heart of Old-Town; so, go eat some decent sushi then stroll around town and see what kind of trouble you can stay out of!

XUcscrA_Wp-tchAWRJyq1Q.text: Great Service  Wings and lobster spring rolls were really yummy.

3ALagPVv91xSiCrZQGvRjw.text: I took my twin daughters here for their 6th birthday. The chef made the experience so special for them, what ever they asked for he did with a smile. The staff came out with a free dessert and sang to them in English and Japanese. They loved every second of it!

po5q5jWMKGLzpuz55NSSJg.text: I was highly impressed visiting Kyoto. I had heard about this restaurant by a friend who encouraged me to check it out. I was not disappointed. Kyoto has a great atmosphere, an impressive food selection, and even more impressive waitstaff. Multiple times the team made sure to check in that my son and I were well taken care of. This is a great choice for breakfast, a date night or a quick drink. I highly recommend Kyoto and will be back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ut9JJYEZA2irWEjsguo0KQ.text: Wow. If you were to ask me what I thought of this place I'd say, "How did you enjoy your nephews middle school graduation?" Same same. Exactly, basically a pointless day. Congrats, you finished eighth grade. Here's a high five bc you're too young for a drink and you didn't do anything worth giving you a card/money for. Only reason I didn't give 1 star is bc the food is better than the rat traps I've eaten at before which were a 1 star.  If they f up your order, don't expect anything other than the "owner" to come stand by your table to tell you he's the "owner" a handful of times and to awkwardly linger around as if he's trying to run a rug and tug to see if you'd like a happy ending but always leaves you unsatisfied.

_sgidBUrtnzVwthBRZ6mrQ.text: This was probably the poorest meal my husband and I have paid for in a long time.  The bartender did not have the experience to make a cocktail. The sushi rolls were so big you could not use chopsticks as well as not being tasty. The edamame was tough. The potstickers were so so. It was very disappointing after seeing high reviews.

G8AurrAh0lZ0S8lDTz6X0w.text: Ok, it was my first time back here in 9 years. It's so much better than my previous experience.   The service was great from the moment I got there. A friend & I sat at the sushi bar & had a fabulous cocktail named something with the word spirit in it. Who can remember these things? I've included a photo.   We were there for a drink and a happy hour snack. We got a couple different kinds of rolls, & both were really good. I'll definitely be back again & much sooner this time.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

DuXKJu-IY4x_L-nTq9va0Q.text: Went here last month on my husbands birthday on March 17th that was a Sunday. The place itself has a cool set up but that's it. I will never go back here again with the horrible service we had. We were a large party for non teppanyaki my first complaint is my sister in-laws silverware napkin had broken glass in it! YES BROKEN GLASS! She could of seriously hurt herself, she is very quite so choose not to make it a big deal. Another complaint is I order a California roll and when it came there was no soy sauce on the table so I asked my server for some and she rolled her eyes at me and walked away. That is extremely rude and horrible service I'm sorry if your job sucks but don't be rude to a paying customer! Another issue was how long it took to receive our food, I understand your busy but it seriously took almost 49 minutes to receive our food and when I received my chicken teriyaki bento box it was cold, and the chicken teriyaki was not even good it tasted gross. My last issue was when we needed our checks they didn't even bother to ask if we wanted separate checks or one all together and it took forever just to get our checks and pay. I would not come back here ever the food was cold and not good, I don't understand how you can mess up on chicken teriyaki. Plus you need to get new servers, for a server to be so rude to roll her eyes over a simple question and I was nice. My whole table noticed how cold and rude your server was. Take your money else where!

rSlEfJU8Jc-nlvRekSafOw.text: Ate there for lunch-- it took a while to get service but I don't feel like that's normal. A few things went wrong early on, from not having menus and the waiter was ready to take our order to asking for us for drinks after we ordered, oh well.   The food was fantastic and very fresh! Best Japanese place I've eaten around Scottsdale. I ordered the ramen bowl. It was very large and only around $8. Definitely will be back!

ebrpKYjycH9-4JG_507q0g.text: Stopped by for some sushi in old town at this place on the corner...had reservation at 10 pm but they sat us down at 850 pm (not at teppanyaki table) which we wanted sushi anyways. Their baseline products were very fresh and very good!! Started with their Hakushika sake which we had 3 bottles...was really really good and went well with their sushi!! Started with their soft shell crab and it was amazing!! Their salmon was fresh, beef sashimi was spicy and unbelievable!!  I would come back for that alone!! The albacore was really fresh...the uni was super fresh!!! When everything came out it was really pleasing!! I honestly will come back to bring my dad for the beef sashimi...different and amazing!!

photos.caption: Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Albacore was really good!! Highly recommend!!
Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Beef sashimi!! It&#39;s seriously amazing...underlying touch spicy...which is perfect!!
Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Smelt egg!! Really good...

gs3dPL-Lvdg6Kggre3I3nA.text: Great food. Very entertaining hibachi chef. I ordered the chicken entree and as always too much delicious food. Enjoyed the experience and will be back!

d-ZmRgwTLHBsKn7eS6CEug.text: One of the best Japanese sushi place that I've been to in Scottsdale! Hmm, how I wish I lived next door.  Their Omakase really stands out to me. Well, I'm not an expert on sushi but have tried quite a bit of places for omakase. What really stands out this place from the others is the combination of the freshness of the fish and the sauce pairing, also comes with a fresh wasabi, Pickled Ginger, California Roll and Edamame. It isn't the cheapest, but a good value for money that couples a good mix of prepared food and sushi. The Prime Beef Teriyaki is also a must try! Plus! A good sake list that runs the spectrum of prices. When it comes to service, based on my experience, it was a two thumbs up quality! I had the chance to talk to the chef, and he's very personable welcoming. The rest of the staff was pretty accommodating too, and they always wear their smile while doing their job. Definitely worth a visit.

Y8EH-PC56Bx5HW1DO8D7HQ.text: I'm giving 5 stars only because it won't let me leave 10 stars. This hidden gem had incredible staff and customer service. Eveytime I come I Feel so welcomed. The food is delicious! Eric is amazing and so hospitable. I would recommend this place to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

dqAILd_re0iQAqKmemu77w.text: I had never been to a tappenaki restaurant before, but I was invited to a birthday party here tonight and it was my first experience! I really enjoyed it, it was a fun time. I thought about ordering the tofu but for $18 I didn't think it would be worth it since I wouldn't have anyone to share my meal with and I was not super hungry. The service there was great, they were super accommodating to me being a vegetarian. They cooked the vegetables away from the meat for me which was really nice! The vegetables were delicious too, a lot of my fave veggies in that mix! As my meal I ended up just getting a veggie roll. It was very tasty, I haven't had too much veggie sushi before, but I liked this quite a bit! I was surprised at how full I was when I left because it didn't seem like that much food, but I was filled up for sure. I would come back, it's really awesome how long it has been there too!

eImR2gsRTzdnzzOO_hKxoA.text: Great little place. Good service and good show  Had teppanyaki - always good  Can't speak to the sushi.

4tyRZ8co_mEEtC74vCAYHA.text: Deliciousness - 3/5 Happiness - 1/5  It is so disappointing how bad this place is as I love teppanyaki cooking and the show that goes with it. And the food here is just fine. The fried rice is tasty and not greasy. The meats were cooked to perfection, though I could have used a bit more flavoring. And the price is reasonable enough ($30-50 for the teppanyaki options).   But the show was lacking for sure. The cook simply refused to interact with the table, not even answering questions. I am partially paying a premium for the show, and there just wasn't a show to be had. A few flips of cutlery at the beginning and then he had his eyes glued to the grill after that. It also took about 30 minutes from ordering for the cooking to begin, that's a long time to wait.  And then, the payment was a mess. We were a party of four. One of us paid $40, one of us paid $50, and the other two paid over $150.00. Why? We have no idea. The restaurant failed to give a detailed receipt of what could have led to such disparity in the bills, let alone two bills over $150.00. We then discovered that they ran our cards multiple times for differing amounts. And we received no apologies, no explanation, and just brusque answers to why they kept taking our cards. I remain convinced that they charged the entire table to the four of us, even though we were not there with the others dining at the table. When I asked to speak to a manager, they just gave me the restaurant's phone number and said to call back later.   I'd recommend going to a happier place for the experience than Kyoto.

P0HDy9Q7N_8fmugDHfVEOA.text: Went at happy hour and had an combination of excellent service, cold beer, hot sake and delicately prepared and fantastic food.  The vegas roll and crispy rice with spicy tuna were both perfect.  We will be back, with friends, to enjoy the teppanyaki, sushi, cold beer and hot sake again very soon.  You, Kyoto, are our new "go to" restaurant!

meTCslcB2nz0k_JnfT5Q3w.text: I have been going here for a VERY long time. They recently went through an ownership change and renovation. IT IS AWESOME. The food is great; fresh, and Oishee des.  If you stopped going while it was closed, give it another try...You wont be disappointed

pxrs1FUyqAAWOuNB0NMAzA.text: Sushi rolls are decent. The salad you get with lunch is chunks of iceberg lettuce. Portions for lunch are good

-taEaeQ0cLeYTUqxEcb_fg.text: We had a 6:15 reservation this evening. It took about 15 minutes for them to seat us after our reservation time. We ordered drinks and food immediately after sitting down. It took about twenty minutes for us to get our drinks, and 45 minutes after ordering we are still waiting for our food. There is only one sushi chef working and just a couple servers. Very poor service and very disorganized. Will not be coming back.

gAm7jadherhhYFfJ9V8byg.text: Great place for lunch! The price and the quality is excellent. It is not the best sushi in the area, but the lunch menu is very cheap and has some good options. They offer different teriyaki meals that come with rice and a salad for around 5 dollars. It is also pretty filling and sometimes I will get a roll or two to go with it.   When going for lunch the service is usually pretty good. There can be a longer wait at night and the prices go up, so I would definitely suggest trying out Kyoto for lunch if you are in the area.

sAv3eBdw0rfdMPE-iUizXg.text: Food- The sushi is rather poorly rolled for my taste.  Many of the rolls are large in size which is normally good but in this case leads to the sushi falling apart when dipping in soy due to the poor technique in rolling them.    Price- It is not as cheap as it should be for the quality but it isn't terrible for sushi prices generally.  The food tastes ok but I find that the poor technique is too much for me to get past when eating sushi.  Fish quality is fine but not the best I have had in Phoenix.  Service- This is by far the worst thing about this restaurant.  NEVER SIT AT THE SUSHI BAR because you will have servers constantly reaching over your shoulders all night (during dinner service at least). The servers should have a place to get food for the tables without having to reach over customers.  This is a total failure of this restaurant design.  I get so angry at the bumping and shoving by the servers at the sushi bar that I will never go back.  Each time I go to give them another shot there aren't any tables and they sit me at the bar.    Go somewhere else to avoid the sub-par, expensive food and terrible service during busy hours.

2EwPSbbdnTc9RPnbkbH6bw.text: It's an authentic and traditional Japanese restaurant in the heart of Scottsdale. Wow, talk about an oxymoron. But, hey, I give props to a sushi place that offers more than loud music, vibrant colors and cream cheese rolls. This place is great for a quiet dinner (at least it was quiet when I went) and for enjoying big slices of sashima.   Granted, I've been once, but the lasting impression I got was that it's a rare find in Phoenix. Downside is you have to cross into Scottsdale to go, so that's what keeps me away.

06dOEjlQvBkgokq4JVLvzw.text: Just like the old days. It can never reclaim those days but memory lane was fun.

uDwGdvi3nIz23QMg8y2NRQ.text: Great food!!! Our bartender Erik took care of my fiance and I very well.  Great atmosphere and prices!!!  We highly recommend this restaurant!!!

_xd2atELdN-pSaVHmarDxw.text: I was tempted to give this place only 3 stars, but since the food is good and the prices are great I gave it 4. The service is pretty bad though. They either rush you or leave you for a long time. I have to be careful if its on my lunch break. You seriously cant find anything cheaper in Old Town. Its hidden and the parking can be awful, but its worth it. The bento boxes are perfect for lunch and cheap. I wish that they would come with a cali roll like most. If your looking for a very casual place for sushi this is a great spot. Not a date night place or anything. Pretty run down. I guess its been around for a long time so I'm thinking they should do some maintenance.

2bGBe3jLSgsCELU9gggaDA.text: This place is excellent price wise and has a decent variety. My only complaint is the setup of the seating...check it out...  ABRA...

Ug8KbC74VHCzxFZQtJ6rlA.text: A True Scottsdale tradition, Kyoto offers fabulous sushi in a dive-y yet oh-so-hip atmosphere. Their Tako Salad is one of the best and the teppanyaki tables (for those who want cooked food) really are a blast.  Kyoto's hidden secret is its great lunch specials. You can get your sushi fix for under $10 and avoid the crowds that come in the evening.  Bento boxes with terriaki chicken will please your non-sushi friends. I'm so glad this place survived downtown Scottsdale's growth spurt!

EO_Nl9J_l3724wk4Bl_p4g.text: This place rocks for Sushi and for saki bombs. It isn't the best sushi I have had, but it does the job whenever we are in scottsdale. The service is really good. They have a lot of choices for sushi lovers! The wait sort of stinks during the busy hours, so keep that in mind.

J1eVkqTdOdguNpw8cKC27Q.text: Can't believe I haven't written a review for Kyoto - I used to go to this place at least 3 times a week when I worked in Old Town Scottsdale.  I've only been there for lunch, and you can't get a better deal.  I would order the #3 lunch special - Chicken Teriyaki & Rice - for $3.50.  Yeah, you read that right...$3.50.  You get chicken, rice, salad, & a few orange wedges - perfect portion for lunch, and it's almost cheaper than bringing your own lunch to work!  The only downside to this place is that if you get there a little after noon for lunch, the service slows WAY down.  I once waited nearly an hour for my food when other times it was out in as little as 10 minutes.  I know places get busy, but they are always busy for lunch, so I'm not sure why they haven't figured that out yet.  They have other items on their lunch menu which includes some sushi, pork, and of couse some more chicken variations.  HIGHLY recommended if you are in Old Town Scottsdale for lunch!

JbLdpXCUAO7cAWdMww28uA.text: Definitely one of the best sushi restaurants I have been to in Scottsdale, AZ.  Rivals some of the sushi restaurants back in San Diego, CA..

F_Q4ONumcLqBTYrQINAnXA.text: I've been going to Kyoto for nearly 10 years now, by far has always been my favorite Scottsdale sushi place. The bento box lunch specials are incredible. Regretably, I have to change my opinion.   The service has gone downhill drastically. My BF and I loved to go for the #8 sashimi box, I don't like salmon so I always sub more tuna. 9x out of 10, order comes out wrong. Haven't been there 1 time when we didn't have to sit with empty water glasses for 15 min. So we stopped going for a while.   Yesterday, we decided to give Kyoto a 2nd chance. Service was perfectly fine this time (noticed a few new faces) but to my lament... Our sashimi was warm and mushy. NOT what you want to see! I couldn't even eat it, so gave to my BF. Well, guess who spent the next 24 hrs sitting on the porcelain throne.   Yes, it's AZ and it's hot. But if it's not fit to eat... DON'T SERVE IT!   I'm truly sad, but I don't think I'll be going back unless I'm in the mood for something cooked.

bNn414kNOifq-OGWzrvWmg.text: I have been a patron for YEARS!  There is no better sushi in Scottsdale. Their fish is as fresh as it gets, they are wonderful people and when we walk in the door, they know where to look at the sushi bar to see if our spots are available...unless Lisa is working at the bar, then we eat there!

laQhhjVsFoIfmJYa8_v3rQ.text: My home away from home....seriously!  I used to eat here three times a week when I lived in AZ.  The owner/service is grrrrreat!!  They treat everyone like family :).   Definitely come here if you love sushi!  For larger parties and events, they also have Teppanyaki in the back room.    Their menu is soooo reasonably priced and absolutely delcious!! My friends and I would come here before going out as well....can't pass up the $4 saki bomber specials...!!!!

oWwDoxUgB1rKBodd77O0GA.text: I knew about this place when I asked a co-worker who lives in the area.  The first time I tried it was great. I talked to to authentic japanese sushi chef and he made Omakase (chef special ) for me. I think he was very good because the second time my coworker and I went again it was another guy cuttnig up the fish. He wasn't very good so I didn't enjoy it.  SO it depends on the chef......

DBylf5xlixgN1cQWj87j1Q.text: Still one of my favorite places for Sushi and Sake.  Sushi was great and portion sizes were just right.  Everything is inexpensive and the atmosphere is fun.

L38DfzT7eZhwVCCU25yVCg.text: Kyoto has the BEST lunch special...  I have not been to any other Japanese restaurant that offers a whole bento box for $3.75-$5.00. What a great deal!!!   They also have many many options....from tempura (My favorite), white fish cutlets, pork katsu, chicken teriyaki, beef teriyaki, etc, etc...   Masa, the owner, was very attentive to accommodate my needs. I used to call and place an order around 11:30-ish and have my lunch ready by the time I got there (since I had to be back in the office exactly an hour from I took off from the office). No such thing as waiting in line...  Kyoto could get too crowded during weekend around dinner time though...  But overall, I give this restaurant five stars. They deliver not just a tasty food but also great service that valued more than the price I had to pay.

bg6IvnNKv5579wsQGKky-g.text: Take the word "bowl" away, and it goes from crap to awesome.     Very Benihana in nature, but I thought the food was superior to Benihana, and, best of all, $4 for a 22oz Kieren and sake.  Awesome deal.     Of course, the table-side entertainment was fun.  They set the table on fire and made a volcano out of an onion.  Fun stuff.

pQS9RUyCgzVJDnNbh_4qvA.text: Some have called Kyoto a classic in terms of a True Scottsdale tradition.   I happen to be a friend of some guys who have sent their daughters to ASU and everything about that tradition loses all of it's appeal once your age hits 29 or your IQ hits 101.  If Scottsdale can be said to be full of people who either live at Club Med or work for Club Med, Kyoto is their kind of place. Loud, cute, semi-drunk and more impressed with itself than anyone ought to be.  That said, just like most trust fund girls, all the teeth are straight and the diction is perfect. It's all very wholesome and lovely, but something about it just strikes you as a bit too..hmm how shall we say.. brightly colored. If you happen to be a man who has survived any one of the four great tests of American manhood (child custody, IRS trouble, felony conviction or heart attack), then this is the kind of place you should avoid. That is because it is chock full of people whose idea of grave danger is being unable to BS their way out of a DUI ticket. If you frown in here, or order whiskey, they're like "Dude, what's with him?"  So my advice to the gentlemen of age and wisdom is to steer clear, if only because you're going to find yourself staring very hard at women young enough to be your (dumbass) daughter, and that's a very icky feeling.   On the other hand, if you answer to 'dude', all I can say is "Duuuuude!"

q786QavZ3L9-AOkbRIhstg.text: They don't cook the fried rice in front of you.  The scallops are the sandiest I have ever tasted...almost not edible. The vegetables tasted like...vegetables...minus flavor. The soup was salty. The salad was...ok. There is nothing desireable about the teppanyaki experience. The sushi looked good. I won't ever know if it is because I have no desire to go back there. Since there are other restaurants that have amazing sushi...I won't be back. Last, the server, was sub par and didn't deserve the tip we gave her. Don't go here...there are so many restaurants that are better in Scottsdale.

7_sMkOJQEsQCvG_hpDWptw.text: I regretably went here for my birthday last night.  Ordered the Ichi roll and got a death mayo alien roll.  This was the worst thing I have ever tasted.   1) it had at least a handful of mayo blahh  2) it had a pound of crab that looked like red/white spaghetti ( soo gross)  3) had the texture of a raw pumpkin sliced in thin strings  4) tasted like licking an old fish  We got the waitress to refund the sushi since it was un-edible.  when she brought the bill it was not itemized and we could not figure out how it came to that much. The entire time our waitress was never there, never refilled our drinks. We finally flagged her down to get a break down of the bill. she came back with the same copy!!! We asked a different person who grabbed her to help us. She came to the table and asked "do you have a problem with me?" WTF!!!  We told her  ignoring what she said " can you just bring us a breakdown of the bill"  She came back AGAIN, with an un itemized copy!!  I would not have tipped her but on parties of 6+ the add 17% gratuity  Which btw she added 20% without permission.  We were there for so long ad wanted to leave otherwise I would have disputed that tip charge in full.  You dont come up to customers and ask if they have a problem with you!!!  Not only was the food the grossest shit ever, the service can suck my ass!!

2TRpE7QdvALXE--Nm-Wh5w.text: 5 stars for lunch options and value, 2.5 stars for lunchtime sushi. 4 stars for dinner, 4 stars for dinner sushi.  This place has two faces - a simple and incredible value during lunch (4$ tasty lunch bento boxes...are you KIDDING?), and then a full blown, non-corporate teppan-yaki at night.  I definitely tend to notice a difference in the quality of the sushi between lunch and dinner with the latter being preferable.  Dinner options are delicious and great fun, but the amazing dimension Kyoto brings to downtown Scottsdale are its lunch offerings.  Seriously, they're good, and under 5 bucks.  That alone makes it worth the trip!

c6QVXMCX-9ZqJ1r0QlN1Mw.text: Went during the day yesterday and was reminded why I don't do that more often. The lunch special was cheap, but shrimp and whitefish lacked the whitefish and was basically just deep fried slices of potato and carrot. The sushi was dogshit and the service was worse.   Getting menus was a chore, the edimame had no salt on it and when I asked for a side of salt, they brought me another shaker of table salt... what kind of place serves edimame and doesn't have sea salt or kosher salt? We drank a lot of saki bombers just to cope with the horrible food and service. Their saki smelled like nailpolish remover, but we couldn't tell when we mixed it with beer... anyway, it got the job done.  Every time I've tried to go here for dinner, they are packed and the wait is an hour. The staff is rude also. Silly me, I'm such an asshole for wanting to eat at your shitty restaurant.  As a sushi joint, this place blows - especially with so many better places within walking distance... including Ra (yes, Ra is better). On the other hand, as a tapanyaki restaurant, this place is pretty good. I suggest making reservations with a large group. It's not the best place for this either, but it's decent and conveniently located.  Kyoto has been around for ages and I've always recommended it to friends. Truth is, this place isn't so special. Never has been. It's possible to go here and have a great time and decent food, but there are more reliable places around.

xXUyW4ZEb-w6Q9lco7bCmg.text: The only sushi place I go to during non happy hour times.  The sushi here is really good and affordable.  I highly recommend trying this place out.  I would give it 5 stars however the wait on a Saturday night was over an hour and staff at the time look like they could be working at a Texas BBQ place (not an insult, as they were friendly but just unexpected for a Japanese restaurant.)

U8a-ZaqBenP0liSlNI8IZA.text: There is a reason why when I lived in Scottsdale for 3 1/2 years I never ate at Kyoto. But upon my last visit I decided I should try a new place. Hmmmm.... I now have also learned to ALWAYS trust my trusty yelper's reviews.  This was a bad choice on my part. Bad, slow service. Poor sushi selection. No wine menu.  The sushi came out cut as thick as a piece of steak. I hate thickly cut sushi. Rolls.....bland. Ambiance was that of a cheap, generic restaurant.  The good.....cheap, sushi was fresh and didn't taste bad. But with all that being said I'll pass on a next time here.

0ejt8Wk6DFSYaHzlaB8V8g.text: Bad...very bad.  Went to this place for dinner on a Sunday night.  I felt pretty comfortable when I saw how crowded it was inside.  It doesn't look like much on the outside.  The sushi tasted pretty good, and it was cheap.  One of my dining partners and I both suffered the next day though.  I felt like crud.  I don't know what it was that got me but I suggest you run, don't walk, away.  I should have known that cheap sushi is generally (not always) cheap for a reason.

hXsifToxh7DJYT8RKxBO1g.text: Kyoto is one of my two favorite sushi venues in the valley (the other being Sakana).  Very good sushi, great portions, and decent prices.  I like how it's never about "the scene" here.

x72Hmkw3Hb-QkzJfLd7mzw.text: I've been going here for almost a decade now.  I love it.  Great prices, great sushi, great chefs.  They have lots of ingredients, including some of the more rare ones like kampyo.  I almost always order a couple of rolls made "my way"...all veggies!  YUM!!!!

wNHfKDozJUyKL1gB_s1Zyg.text: Awesome and QUICK service plus prices are great.

5ZKb4Gce2wCo2GVJCvSYmw.text: Kyoto is now one of my favorite restaurants. I took a date there late on a Saturday night - it was perfect! The food was delicious, the cook entertaining, and the ambiance unique. I will definitely be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

TKGxkhNOgPOgDA7mc6FseA.text: Had an issue with cross-contamination of foods on the Teppanyaki grill, which caused me to get e-coli. I was very sick the night after.   I had the steak and shrimp. My steak was cooked next to someone's chicken. Additionally, the steak was very cold when it was served to me.   When I spoke with friends about my experience, they told me that they either had the same issues or knew of others who got ill.   My suggestion is to go to Benihana instead if you are craving Teppanyaki style Japanese cuisine

_hIG2bg68Po6-tRz_u2z0w.text: 3.5 stars! After eating Pure Sushi, I'd say it doesn't have the freshest raw sushi -- and it doesn't have the best Americanized sushi. I did like the caterpillar roll as well as the tuna belly nigiri. The fried rice was tasty, however, because I like spicy, I'd add some Siracha to add an extra kick to it. It makes me crave tomato fried rice. The scallops were also good, however, I've had better ones at Roka Akor (although the one here is better priced for sure!) My other friends love this place. I think if I come here again, I'd opt to get the Salmon volcano roll -- I hear it is superb!

w6l31qJGIvOWDgk6D99xoA.text: As mentioned earlier, the best thing about this place is the super cheap, but super delicious lunch bentos.  You get a main dish, rice, salad, and an orange for under $4. If that's not enough, you can get double meat for a buck or two more.  I highly recommend the ginger pork or the katsu.  My friend I normally go with is a big fan of the white fish (fried or grilled).  The sushi here isn't bad.  It's nothing super special, but I don't come here for the sushi so it's not a big knock against the place.  As they would say on ebay: A+++ Great Seller! Would eat here again!!!

wqdn7w2yQe2dhtTdcHVoSw.text: Was having a great experience until my girlfriend pointed out a roach on the sushi bar! I understand it can happen, but it really did ruin my appetite. :(

kiVzVdasQorICL4J2uox_Q.text: One of my favorite places to get sushi in Arizona.  Their prices are very reasonable and the sushi is very fresh.  The cooking table is fun too if you'd rather have some cooked stir-fry type food.  I'd recommend eating there before 7 pm, because it gets really crowded anytime after that.

HJy8Ro3CII5e7k7hrsUgfg.text: My first Sushi experience ever when I lived in Phoenix. Still in my mind as the best place I've ever been. Pretty famous place for famous people. I remember the owner being a really friendly guy and there are actually Japanese sushi masters making the sushi.

QDgQsDIUo0EZ0FwzWp_zUg.text: I've been going to Kyoto for years. This place is great for lunch. Good food at a great price. Very low prices considering it's in Old Town Scottsdale. They'll even let you take out sushi unless it's a zillion degrees and your health may be at risk. Try any of the generous lunch specials, which come with rice and salad.  At night, try the saki bombers at a low price before you take off to the other bars. It's a great way to get your night started.

n80uJD89lgolIztfeLB7mg.text: My husband and I visited this past weekend for the second time. The first time was about 4 years ago and the food and service was excellent. Unfortunately this time was unsatisfactory. First, I called to make a reservation and was told to come at a later time because the restaurant was busy. When we arrived 20 mins earlier, the restaurant was dead. We sat at an 8 person grill with one other couple. The chef came quickly and our food was all prepared in 15 mins. My main complaint concerns the portions of food. I ordered the shrimp dinner and was given 8 tiny shrimp. I was hungry when we left. At other teppanyaki restaurants, the portions are healthy and satisfying. My husband ordered steak and shrimp. The steak was overcooked and he also received 8 shrimp. His portions were acceptable. His meal was $5 more than mine and received twice the amount of food. Moral to this story - order a combo or you'll be hungry and I mean very hungry!!!

6RadWfMdqfFC3ptoaD2yKw.text: Awesome lunch specials for crazy cheap.  Greta sushi as well. Never had a bad experience.

qzxJGIxx9mvnsSR27yD1Iw.text: When we were getting ready for our trip to Arizona I got on Yelp to stake out the best Sushi places in the area. Kyoto seemed to have some of the best reviews, so we decided to check it out. We got there just in time, they close at 2pm for lunch and open back up for dinner later in the day.  The salmon was fantastic. The unagi was fantastic. the rolls were nothing spectacular, in fact, a little dry. But, all in all, a quality sushi place. The prices were reasonable, about what you'd expect to pay for decent sushi. What I want to know is this: Is there a good "all-you-can-eat" sushi place anywhere in Phoenix or the surrounding burbs?

cJOQnEX8z5F9rvNeVufQSg.text: I arrived at 8 o'clock for my reservation I didn't really get to try to restaurant out because by 8:30 we were still waiting to get seated.   It makes no sense to take reservations if you're not going to honor them.

mE7wOFeNdqdHOVYn7byYjg.text: The ramen is fantastic. We get it with the regular noodles, and it would be accurate to say I'm currently addicted.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Top: large ramen with chicken broth and chicken. Bottom: large ramen with beef broth, a boiled egg and chicken.

iE7jEz2nUa_fVX2MpG1JTw.text: I actually don't care if the food is good at this point, the service sucks. From the minute I walked in to this very moment this shit sucks. Went to the bar to order a drink because nobody took my order at the table and the bartender told me it wasn't happy hour. The menu clearly says happy hour from 9p-close. After he realizes that it's happy hour, he fails to give me my change. Yeah I would never ever return here again

EhM7yzTXmZ8bkYD2B9wdVg.text: Don't miss Happy Hour!!! This place ROCKS since re-opening!! We came a few times after they first reopened and you could tell they were getting it all back together, but better than before.... And they have accomplished that may I say!! We love the quail egg shooters too.... Give them a try.... Live a little!!

photos.caption: Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

QlLlfiTJEyRMP94_sKetIw.text: This place has always been a 10 in any category!!..The cooks at this place are very good at what they do Kama is excellent..All the food dishes are fresh .. plentiful and enjoyable.ill always come back to this place.its #1 in my book.

DNh7jzoGKZTxPFF_GmIVpw.text: There was no hostess in the front to give us a seat, do we had to walk in a little to see some people. We sat down and ordered some food- the poke bowl, the sashimi platter, an oyster shooter, and the ramen with some toppings.   Poke bowl- very flavorful, very fresh, pre-mixed, had lots of fish and avocado but TOO SALTY sashimi platter- pretty good, and since we didn't like albacore, they let us substitute it for ika (squid) sashimi. It came with edamame, miso soup (TOO SALTY), steamed rice, and a salad. The salad was actually pretty good, since the dressing was miso sauce, and the whole thing was also very fresh. Ramen- we got it with fresh noodles, and it was very good, but TOO SALTY. you can add lots of toppings to it. Oyster shooter- pretty spicy, but very good. Only downside is that it only came with one oyster.  Overall, everything is very fresh, just really salty. The service isn't that good.

BKqR-ZTxYcWV0_eBar7Pwg.text: I've been to Kyoto several times. Their tree-star rating is dead on.   Their sushi is on point. The best of this place is their lunch bento boxes and the daily specials-- however that's only if they've taken the time to actually update the daily specials. Last time I went for lunch, the waitress said "The specials will probably be up by dinner time. But I guess that doesn't do anything to help you now." Why not just verbally offer the same specials as another day? Or, better yet, just come up with something then since the place wasn't the least bit busy. The service is very hit and miss. I'll leave it at that.   Don't be fooled by the signs for $3 ramen. You're paying $3 for broth, and by the time you have all the standard ingredients, you're paying $10-12 for something mediocre-at-best.   For the best experience, go for lunch. Not for dinner.

G2hc4856Tmy4jxgTNtRhMA.text: 1. The food was blah, we didn't leave full.  2. Service was slow, we couldn't even figure out who our server was. 3. They charged my debit card for not only my meal, but another meal that was not mine.  4. They did not tell me anything about this other charge, like she was just hoping I wouldn't notice. I'm a server so I know, when you make a mistake, especially with someone's card/money, you correct it and then explain what happened to the customer so they know. I was told nothing. 5. The next day I found the extra charge on my card and drove the 30 minutes back over to the restaurant to get it fixed. 6. The staff was nice during this and the manager was helpful but overall it was just a very frustrating experience that was completely avoidable.  - if you eat here, pay attention to your card and bank statement.

en6Ny36VizFHAfN_9Yq7sA.text: I love Kyoto. I use to work right nearby and would go almost weekly. The food is always amazing and never a long wait for lunch so you can easily go during a break. Highly recommend their bento boxes as a person who orders the same thing every week, but I hear great things about their ramen bowls which are on the newer side.

Tz2_iPgEWZxZIX2E2aop-w.text: Food was amazing. Recommend the jalapeno popper appetizer. Filet and shrimp were also good. Awesome drinks and atmosphere. We will be back For sure. Was an awesome spot to go for my birthday.

VkHUXSA_BmiOLWzV1d_-mw.text: Great service.. food was amazing I got the scallops. The only different thing I would prefer would be the sauces they give.  I would prefer my scallops with some type of buttery sauce . It's definitely fun to see them cook for you it's always fun.. drinks were great bartender made me a cucumber drink it was amazing .. we all hAd a lot of fun

GYjvWm5W2fmtR7WKlkjM7g.text: Enjoyed dinner with friends here last Thursday. Good food, great showmanship. Prices a bit high but that's to be expected for teppanyaki. Service was a tiny bit slow but that gave us a chance to socialize. Not very busy. Hope they are busier on weekends. They really paid attention to detail and kept our order correct. (Sorry, no pics.)

k1HSKTDi_oC1JP1U2L2mdg.text: I've dined here before and it's always a good time. Servers are friendly, foods cooked well, and fun show. Lots of options: ramen, sushi, apps, teppanyaki, and kids meals. Better for bigger parties but there's a bar area. 22oz $5 sake bombs and happy hour menu is great

EPJP-KzHDSZKbRw_6c8jRQ.text: I had never been to Kyoto so yesterday was my first visit. I had a great time but honestly I think it was the company more than this spot. It's kinda like a second rate or knockoff Sapporo or Kobe.  Sorry. The place needs an update or renovation badly. I will say the service was good. The food was okay wasn't amazing wasn't bad but I basically did the chef grill which was cool but basically chicken fried rice for $20 so I'm like ehhh.  Not the best place for drinks either the bar was out of everything so we opted for wine which was cool because the server gave us happy hour wine prices. My recommendation is go, eat, have fun with your group but don't expect be wowed. You won't be...

60D0_brUgMZW0GApLP8_2g.text: Tried to go to Breakfast Club next door but wait was too long. They advertised breakfast so tries it. Pretty good and everything was fresh but pancakes sort of chewy. No crowd.  The "everything" breakfast a little smaller than expected but good

42doi-9Yd6sXH7lAAGhJsA.text: Always look forward to coming to this restaurant Erin the sushi South does an excellent job imitating a role that we have at home and he did an excellent job. Me and my wife love this place food is always good. We've been here for lunch several times.

m1cQf35NOe8YCUCh3kkGwA.text: Good experience and good food.  A bit pricier than other hibachi places in my travels but good nonetheless.

rcYGB6U6lD0yPch7fJP-4Q.text: Was visiting my daughter at GCU, and we went here. Food was great.  Sat at teppanyaki grille, cook was very entertaining and engaging with table

oESt306DjoomQ6SgRg_GAQ.text: We went pretty late at night with a big group, and the service was amazing! I think our main waitress was named Maria and she was super thoughtful, polite, and joked around with our rambunctious group. The manager (I assume) also helped our table out with drinks, utensils, etc.   We were seated quickly and checked on regularly. The chef who cooked our teppanyaki was awesome too. The food and drinks were super good (I loved the miso soup), but the service really stood out to me. It can be hard to make sure everyone at a big table always has what they need, and the staff here really went above and beyond.  I would definitely come again!

t91ry2lGV0NTpZSGw1PHug.text: This place was hot years ago, then closed for an extended period of remodeling, but it's open again. After some initial re-opening growth pains, it's back! Kyoto is every bit as good as it was, and has a few new items on the menu (the Dynamite Scallops are superb). The staff is attentive and friendly, the food is terrific, and it's back to being our regular Date Night spot.

j87Q-9biPxBaK0WB2zPTfw.text: This is one of my favorite local sushi joints! For a fresh and inexpensive sushi meal they can't be beat. Great service, great sushi, always fresh and really great prices. A wonderful neighborhood sushi joint.

b2tvngFlmCNtfiSN4pztIQ.text: Cheapest bento box lunch I've ever seen. Under $4??? And $6 for a sashimi bento box which includes 9 pieces of decent sashimi (3 tuna, 3 salmon, 3 yellowtail). Such amazing prices!  Boyfriend likes the fish katsu, which reminds me of nicer fish sticks, and I had the pork katsu which was not bad, but not amazing. Next time I would get the teriyaki or just the sashimi. Overall, very nice service  - they had no problems splitting our tab with the other person we went to lunch with - and pretty decent food for the price. Definitely a great choice for a cheap and filling lunch.

5yptO4Yw2cV5H882yl6Fqg.text: Walking by this place, I always thought it was closed, but apparently its not! I had a craving sushi so my date took me here. What a shocker! The sushi was really yummy and the service was pretty good. This restaurant has a sushi bar, tables, teppanyaki tables, and a bar. I enjoyed the atmosphere, it was pretty low key compared to other sushi joints in Old Town, which is nice change. I will be coming back!

1QCXhHgpRMs0LAzKuOHf2g.text: "A-OK". That describes fairly accurately my experience here. I imagine if I had gone for the teppanyaki I would have a higher rating, but I was in the mood for sushi.  Unfortunately, the sushi selection here is extremely limited. The fish was nice and fresh, although not the best I've had. And there was a strange spice on the white fish that I found quite surprising. Not necessarily bad, but it seemed out of place. The tako salad was quite tasty, although it was absolutely drowned in ponzu sauce, so beware!  Overall, I wouldn't consider this as a "destination" to go back to; however, I wouldn't say no if I were invited to go eat here again.

4eb0QMkKQatIMrT9yUtOtQ.text: I stopped in with a friend on a Saturday night after a friend had recommended it to me and was totally thrilled we did. We sat at a table for sushi and waited no longer than 10 minutes for a table - amazing for 8 pm on a Saturday in old towne.  Unfortunately, they had sold out of the oysters, but the other dishes we'd ordered were fabulous - starting with a seared tuna dish, then softshell crab roll, rainbow roll, and the green mussels. The seared tuna was cooked and cut perfectly - just the right temperature with a peppery "rub," the rolls were a decent size with thick cuts of fish and plenty of flavorful crab, and the mussels were a tad overcooked for my preference but the creamy texture and buttery flavor still made it a winner.   The thing I appreciated most was actually the service - we weren't rushed or hassled, and the food came out a dish at a time, giving us a chance to eat and enjoy before getting our next dish. At other sushi joints, I am constantly feeling rushed while trying to fit all of the dishes on the table (and I'm not what you'd call a slow eater!). This was a happy medium for me. The server confirmed that we were ready for the bill instead of just dropping it off without asking - it's the little details that make a big difference to me.  My only other con was creepy old men leering at us from the bar...but that's what you get in Scottsdale.

S6OHarLOqFSMKaiu8Hr5Aw.text: I've been coming to this place since college, and I can tell you its definitely one of those "an oldie but a goodie".  So, its not a fancy schmancy place with hip party music playing and it doesn't serve mixed drinks with cute names like "hello kitty", but it should be a staple to anyone's lunch place repertoire.    They serve bento boxes (basically a lunch box with rice, your choice of entree, salad and slices of oranges--a healthy dessert!) for $3.75.  If you're feeling like a high roller, you can order the sashimi bento box, and that will set you back a whopping $6.  Who says you can't eat good for cheap?

oLacsQqwvFOltIvlviNbUQ.text: Ok. Let me qualify this 4 star rating.  It's for lunch. And it's mostly for price.  It's certainly not the best Japanese restaurant I've ever been to. And the food isn't the best. But it's decent. The price is excellent (for lunch).  I used to come here often and grab the Bento box and a California Roll with my buddies for lunch and I'd the door having spent just 10 bucks including tax and tip. I'd be full, and ready to coast through the afternoon on a semi-food coma.  It's worth the visit based on the cost.   Now you probably want to know why I don't think this is the best restaurant in the world. Well, this is an OLD place. It hasn't been updated since the NIxon administration...at least it seems that way....but what do I know? I was born during last Carter year.   The Bento Box is $3.75 and you get Teriyaki Chicken w Mushrooms, Rice, a little salad. It's really not bad for the price.  Add a roll for another $3.75 and you got yourself a snazzy cheap little meal.  The restaurant is dark, it kind of smells, but who cares. It's cheap, you'll be in and out of there in no time.  I probably wouldn't go there for dinner.   Peace.

QTQj9dMTjRAUZP4X2B9n6Q.text: I was told this place used to be the "hot spot"  back in the day.  My review is strictly based on the bar and teppan experience(I have not tried their sushi yet).    We had 9 in our group on a Thursday night and we started off with a round of beers at the bar.  It's a nice touch that every beer we ordered came with a small bottle of sake!  The bar is small and we pretty much took up the whole area, which also happens to be right where the front door of the place is.  There are a few teppan tables in the very back of the place, and our group of 9 just barely fit comfortably.  The "show" before the cooking started was one of the better ones I've seen(it was the first time I've seen them light a trail of fire around the table and into each of our dinner plates!).  I ordered steak and lobster with fried rice, and it turned out pretty delicious.  One disappointment I had during the cooking process was that the fried rice was not prepared for us on the grill...it came out in bowls straight from the kitchen.    The miso was ok, nothing to write home to mom about.  They do NOT have "golden shrimp"(I'm beginning to think no teppan place in Arizona has this).  Bathrooms are small and kind of grungy(1 urinal, 1 stall, 1 sink).

PSh4uETOeSdsV4FObmHi3g.text: Though I'm familiar with Scottsdale and live close to Old Town I had somehow never noticed Kyoto despite it's proximity to the Breakfast club and Bungalow.  I had gone with a friend who wanted sushi, thinking (and not really minding) that he was talking about the Kyoto Bowl on Scottsdale Rd near the Walgreens. No no no. This is a much better culinary experience by far.  Besides the surprise birthday details we were seated at one of the teppanyaki tables and this not being my first time it was a great experience. There wasn't any showboating by the cook this time but that was fine with me. Had an array of sushi that was all fresh tasting and well proportioned and some excellent sake too.   It might be slightly priced on the high end of things (but I didn't pay for it so I can't say precisely more about it) but a great place to go eat with friends or a loved one.

MGw8RKdlS9QSMEwtTUCinw.text: While I'm a sushi fan, my husband is a sushi FIEND - we made biweekly trips to his favorite haunt in NYC (Monster Sushi) and if he was on his own for dinner, I could always count on him to be there for a bite.  After relocating to Phoenix, he'd been jonesing hardcore for non-commercial, non-fussy sushi in epic proportions served with a smile.  Our trusted source told us that Kyoto was their favorite and we had to indulge.  The mixed views on Yelp made be a tad nervous, but I like to give places an unbiased chance.  Very glad that I did.  The interior of the place is a little strange given the shape of the restaurant and lack of windows, but we made ourselves cozy in a table next to the sushi bar.  I also did not notice a pre-club atmosphere - it was chill the night we went, but maybe it was because we went after work (which is probably on the earlier side for the see and be seens).  No teppan for us that night - it was all about the sushi.  We started with a pleasantly savory miso soup, flavorful seaweed salad and moist, tender tako (octopus) salad.  Next was my favorite dish of the night (and no, not traditional for sushi, but whatever) - a peppered, seared tuna with onion sauce.  Divine!  I could have had three plates of this and called it a day.  Most of the folks in our party ordered rather classic rolls, while I ordered an additional three specialty rolls (Candy Cane, Ichi and Shrimp Tempura - I love to crunch it out).  The rolls were so HUGE we struggled to eat it all.  Keep in mind that those specialty rolls are massive, particularly the Ichi (should have been called Ichi the Killer Roll) which you could barely eat with chopsticks.  I was a mess of dungeoness crab and spicy tuna by the end of the night, but I was happy.  Price was absolutely fair for the quality of the food - there are many (MANY) overprices sushi places in Scottsdale and many dirt cheap places in the valley.  This one charges fairly and keeps the quality up.  I don't ever mind paying if it's worth it.  Will most definitely come back and hopefully take in some teppan next time :)

m7O5lFgED-I1kqrv3vrdnw.text: Got to revise my review. Wrote a few months ago that the quality had slipped, but they are back to their old strength, and then some. Awesome sashimi! Besides the usual (tuna, yellowtail etc,), they had Marlin and Mahi today - wow! Service has always been great, by the way.

0-Swyl0DWbycdoi3eyBUgw.text: I found this place serendipitously when I was strolling around, looking for a place to eat dinner with mom after ArtBridge Thursday. We sat at a bar where a chef made food right in front of us quietly. We chose more authentic style dishes like simple sushi and rolls without "fried and smothered in mayo crap." They were not shy with ingredients, and I thought their food was delicious.

NNcMd-Sr8qUVNZ2i91Q_kQ.text: The BEST sashimi in the valley! Ask for belly-cut yellowtail; so tender and juicy! They also have teppan tables that are fun to sit at if you're with a big party. The filet and scallops are delicious, the marinade compliments both of them. There can be long waits on the weekends, but it's definitely worth it!

_y1R6TNotvVid2VzvIXHiQ.text: Kyoto is what I like to call the "diner of sushi places."  This isn't necessarily a negative.  The prices are very fair, and the atmosphere is very laid back.    In an area of super "hip" sushi, it's nice to have a place with a local feel.  If you are looking for fancy, out of the box rolls, exceptional service, or a great ambiance, this isn't the place for you.  If you're looking for cheap, good, normal sushi at a great price it's worth a shot.

AbdQ-s_os2ekk0AUqqRFXg.text: My go to place for sushi.  5 because the price is right.  Point Break roll will rock your world.  Bartender is a really nice guy.  Ambience is old school and is a nice break from a lot of the sushi spots in old town.

ffLMYlWqFmmTCxJDvE1ccw.text: The service was very quick and the waiters were very friendly. The food was great as well. I wish they had a more detailed sushi menu for people who are new to sushi.

YTszS-20AsJuvNXTbwgdlQ.text: This is one of my go-to lunch places since it is one of the few restaurants in the area besides Quiznos , Chipotle or the food court at the mall where you can get a lunch for under $10.  Actually, it is under $5.  Serious value!  I love the bento boxes, everything is always fresh.  I usually get the teriaki chicken since I don't like fried so much or sometimes when I feel like a splurge I get the sashimi.  Either way it is always good.

iz4X1dhXZv8JFN9wtAoJzw.text: I have been going to Kyoto for more than 20 years. It's still my favorite sushi in Scottsdale.

6RByRcneFdMhcTvU3cQ2oA.text: Great find! The boyfriend and I were aiming to check out Geisha A Go Go's happy hour but no seats and loud music drew us to find a more intimate spot. Kyoto hit the spot! The sushi was great at a reasonable price off the regular menu. The staff was friendly and laid back yet still attentive which was refreshing.  I loved all the rolls we tried: (in order of favorites) caterpillar, Philadelphia, Salmon volcano (warning it is salt that they light on fire), tuna maki, and another I can't remember. Although the boyfriend is still partial to Roka Akor, I think this is my new favorite location! I definitely cannot wait to come back and please open a location in Glendale!

eNKsKZwT32BloVGXAloygA.text: "Real Japanese cuisine"   For all those that think Teppan style is authentic Japanese food I hope my yelp opens your eyes.  Don't get me wrong I love to eat with a group of friends at Kyoto.  But know that the Teppan style cooking is an authentic tourist trap created by a chain restaurant owner in Japan.    The Review  I like the Kyoto bowl for but a good Japanese food.  The chiefs create a great experience and atmosphere and the Sushi is pretty good.  I have eaten here a few times, and have had a saki bomb here or there. I learned the hard way how power full the drinks are so use with caution.

qNtsf9mG9c8EMYQhXoXupg.text: A favorite sushi meal and environment.  The sushi bar is my choice eating location whether I am alone or with guest.   I appreciate the art of sushi preparation almost as much as i enjoy eating it.  Yellow Tail or Tuna sashimi, Alaskin roll, Uni with quail egg, crunchy Salmon Skin roll, miso soup, and sake bomber...I am all good.  Always great service, respectful staff, and great food.  Good times!

AhCgettPZAmDLUtpLGkK1w.text: Kyoto - This is a nice place to host a birthday gathering of some sort because of the space and the hibachi style cooking is such a fun way to enjoy dinner.  With that being said, I wouldn't say it's nearly as good as some of the other hibachi restaurants I've tried in other parts of the country, but hey.   We were a party of 6 dining for a friend's birthday on a Saturday night.  For appetizers we started out with Kyoto Sticky Drumettes and Crispy Shrimp Tempura.  The shrimp tempura was lightly fried, lightly seasoned and thankfully, not greasy.  The fried chicken wings were fried nicely but bland.  No salt and pepper at all.  You NEEDED the sauce that accompanied the wings.  I'll pass next time!  Our entrees varied between the 6 of us and I don't remember every dish that every person ordered, although I've tried every single one.  They just weren't that memorable! 2 of us ordered the chicken and shrimp hibachi style. 1 person ordered the Filet Mignon hibachi style. I wouldn't order the chicken and shrimp again.  The chicken was tasteless and dry.  The shrimp was overcooked and definitely frozen. The filet was cooked medium and taste really good.   I ordered 1 cocktail from the bar, again can't remember the name because there was nothing memorable about it.  I chose wine for my second drink because well ...you can't go too wrong with a Malbec.

er7HvEb4BkJWlVuBj58pKg.text: I LOVE Kyoto! I have been here SO MANY times and I'm always so happy (and stuffed) by the end of dinner! We usually sit at the sushi bar and order during HAPPY HOUR! They have a LIST of GLUTEN-FREE sushi rolls to pick from!   Note: the California roll says it's gluten-free on the menu but when we asked our waiter, we had to SPECIFICALLY order it to be gluten-free. So instead of being made with crab mix, they use crab pieces!   They also have GLUTEN-FREE SOY SAUCES! You can't have sushi without soy sauce, right? We ordered a gluten-free California roll, a Philadelphia roll, and an Alaskan roll. Our FAVORITE was the Alaskan roll: served with salmon, avocado, and cucumber on the inside with grilled salmon and lemon on top! The sour lemon really added extra depth to the roll and mixed well with the soy sauce!

photos.caption: Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gluten-Free California Roll
Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gluten-free soy sauce
Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Alaskan Roll

QvunQ4FZ_t5zSIwc2Hdt3g.text: I was not expecting to walk into a Japanese restaurant with knock of Nintendo games behind the bars, but that's what I found! You can sit at the bar and play one/two player games and you drink and eat. All the games were strange knock-offs of old schools Nintendo games, but we're fun to play with none the less. I was happily surprised by the ramen, its cheaper than most. You start off with a base of $4 and choose your broth/proteins/toppings from there. While it wasn't the best ramen I've had it was good for the night. We also got delicious plum sangria. It was sweeter then I prefer my alcohol usually but fit with the vibes.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

OGTvHl6IyNO-ApI4UGhvBw.text: So sad to take off a star, but after a less than mediocre experience last night, I feel the need to update my fellow Yelpers...  I did have fond memories of dining at Kyoto over the years... and I wanted to share those with my family.  I recently had the opportunity to take my daughter out to dinner for a little mommy-daughter date, and she agreed to be adventurous and check out the "restaurant where they cook in front of you."    I called ahead and got a reservation... We arrived a few minutes early and sat to find an underwhelming ambiance and pretty lackluster service.  We made the most of it and stayed positive, and we enjoyed our time together and met the other diners seated at our hibachi table, but all things considered, the dinner -- especially the food -- was meh.  While it was fun to watch the food prep, there weren't too many tricks or anything super remarkable besides some fire and smoke... Right off the bat, my daughter's plate broke right in front of us which scared us both a bit.  We didn't even get any apology or explanation for that.  Luckily, my daughter enjoyed the edamame starter I ordered her and I enjoyed our ginger salads... the soups were just okay.  She barely touched her chicken hibachi entree and while I ate my shrimp and veggies, I found them to be way over sauced and nothing special.    It was indeed an experience, but I will not be rushing back anytime soon... sorry Kyoto.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

nJ-4ZAzlpqLk1plp0vKImA.text: I really wanted to like this place more because the service was super friendly but the fish was only ok.   We had a few rolls including the humorously named (but not too spicy) ticket to hell.   I'd go back and order differently but not before trying some other local establishments.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

A4ygWz9D-0nh-6v1gsRYRQ.text: I love this place.  If you're looking for a more fun version of the other more famous tepenyaki grill, otherwise known as the B word you've come to the right place.  We went for an office lunch one day and the food was excellent, the chef was entertaining and so much fun.  The prices are a little high but what you would expect from a place like this, especially being in the heart of old town.  The steak always comes out super tender, the fried rice is amazing and the veggies are cooked perfectly.  such a super fun choice for dinner when you want some variety to the typical night out.   Oh and the bar has old school nintendo games too!  highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

J5K3xEOzxCPypBjUVI4nHQ.text: We did the tapenyaki grill the other night. The food here was delicious. The service-not so much. Our waitress was not very attentive, and acted upset whenever we asked her for anything. On top of that, the kitchen forgot to give the chef a serving of chicken to cook, and when he flagged her down to tell her, she gave him HUGE attitude about it. It seemed as if the staff here doesn't realize that guests are listening to them as they talk. For a restaurant in old town, they really need to work on professionalism.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Filet minon and shrimp add on

S8kR7OmEJz9x8gPs4ni0XA.text: Legit disgusting.  Overcooked, super dry chicken, overcooked, soggy noodles and the most overcooked tuna teppanyaki (see picture).  This was an $80+ grubhub order.  Definitely not ordering again.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. WAY overcooked teppanyaki
Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Dry chicken in fried rice

v5crM1TXTG9Zuvoe69NA1A.text: 10 years ago this was a hot spot. 2 years ago it was dead. Glad I gave it another shot. They have upgraded the facilities and food. Party of 8 and we had a great time. Food was fabulous, the cook was entertaining and if it wasn't perfectly cooked to your satisfaction he made a new one. Servers are a bit slow but I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

cSElPqtodNJYWDiM7tW06w.text: My wife and I enjoyed our dining experience at Kyoto, and although there was nothing significant to complain about, it just didn't offer the flare and excitement of some of the Hibachi/Teppanyaki dinners we are used to. The building is aged and decor is dated, which takes nothing away from the quality of food, but unfortunately doesn't do much to contribute to the ambience.   The chef's performance was a highlight, he was talkative and efficient and funny, just as we would expect. Unfortunately the food was just different from what we are used to. Fried rice wasn't as buttery and soft, and the veggies were just too "mixed". I suppose we may just be guilty of enjoying our southern, buttery, goodness from the Carolinas.   Overall, Kyoto provided us a good dining experience, just not at the top of our "must dine at again" list.

L70s0ibkpwwAsi5JGP_yQg.text: Good fast food California rolls and teriyaki bowls. Chicken is fresh vegetables good nothing taste too processed. Not too expensive and something for everybody. Definitely worth a try! Conveniently located in mid Scottsdale.

0zCVtFyOACL7WoIONtNYQw.text: Stopped here for dinner last week, when my son and I were in town to see some spring training games.  We were seated promptly and the service was really good.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  We got the Okinawan sweet potato fries free with my Yelp check-in offer.  The fries were just OK and the Miso dressing wasn't as flavorful as we would have liked.    However, the Eel and Cucumber roll was good.  My son ordered the Beef Teriyaki and I ordered the Chicken Teriyaki dinners.  The dishes came with a large portion of steamed rice and there were a mound of mushrooms, onions, bell peppers and egg plant under the meat.  At first glance, we thought there wasn't enough food.  However, once we dug-in and finished our dinner, we left with full stomachs and were very content.  We enjoyed the Teriyaki sauce they use, since it was a bit thicker than most places and quite tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Beef Teriyaki dinner
Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Eel and cucumber roll
Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Okinawan Sweet Potato Fries.  Free with Yelp check-in.

dd8lGslonGfvmGR2vBljEQ.text: I went for the first time in 1982!!! And today I returned to a wonderful meal. The sashimi Yellow tail and Albacore were delicious. The bento box was incredible value and full of yumminess. My Ramen Miso Soup was perfect. I chose the base, the spiciness, the protein and the veggies. So falvoursome...our waitress A..... was so sweet. Happy to be back. It's going to become my local go to for Miso!
