R43rZZQsLI28YMq111MmNA.text: If I could give no stars I would!!! don't waste your money and especially don't celebrate anything special because you will be disappointed.:( I took my son there for his 19th birthday with family because he wanted teppanyaki.WASTE OF $$$ Spent over $300.00 for the 6 of us and will NEVER go back and I WILL tell ALL friends and family about our experience! I apologized to my son as is wasn't a fun and yummy family dinner together to celebrate his special day.Food was horrible, dry, bland,soggy and the chef at our table was as as exciting as a bucket of hair!! They also said they would sing happy Birthday that wasn't done either.Also this place needs a good cleaning of their windows and decor inside. the vases on each side of the window some had flowers tilting some didn't, Its outdated. Completely a disappointment.

Ovqx4kQl_gzSmRuHXgx0Fw.text: My husband and I LOVE sushi date nights because it is something that I don't make at home. That said, Kyoto is one of our go-to spots because you can sit at the sushi bar and watch their chefs work their magic + they have an INCREDIBLE happy hour!   ALSO - check in on Yelp for a complimentary Sunomono Salad (cucumber salad). It is a big portion too!   My absolute musts when I come are spicy edamame, miso soup, house salad (I love their ginger dressing), fried rice, and then...the SUSHI! We actually switch up the rolls every time because we like to try new things but last night, we ordered the CRAZY roll and you guys - it was a dream come True! I'm currently obsessed with shishito peppers and this roll was topped with them + they DO NOT skimp on the avocado. Yes, please! We also love the basics like spicy tuna, spicy crab, etc. Also, their fried rice is the best fried rice that i've EVER had. It is SO flavorful and you can order a small side if you don't want the big order. But the big order has chicken, steak, AND shrimp in it. Pretty hard to resist.   Anywho, we'll definitely be back soon! Thank you for always curing our sushi cravings! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yelp Check in offer!!
Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fried rice is amazing!!!!
Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Crazy Roll

n-_fwkVSs0poTj9WlLhPDQ.text: Read full review for food review:    Went for a birthday. Wednesday at 6:30.  Not busy. Ordered sushi for apps but the waitress said we had to order the tapeakin at the same time to make sure we got it at the right time. Tepenaki came and no sushi. Sushi came as dessert and then before we were done eating, they brought out dessert. I get wanting to rotate tables but give me a break. No water refill unless we asked or drinks.  The service out weighed how good the food was for my friends bday. We were all beyond annoyed. They did try to make up for the lack of EVERYTHING and take 25% off the sushi we ended up taking home anyway and then gave us a free drink at the end of the night.   Not enough for a $600 meal that they tried to scoot us out of in an hour.  Won't be back. However- the Vegas roll was unbelievable!  And the chef at the table was great too.... only reason they are getting 2 stars. The food was 5 stars.

zLi6eIlxZ6HK-XOj71UJWQ.text: So poorly organized and managed ... one of the worst dining experiences we had experienced from start to finish.   - seating on a reservation took more than 30 mins of waiting - seeing seated patrons get up and leave because they were waiting too long to get served - ordering a drink 3x and having to send it back because the soda was so flat & still being charged for it - placing our orders and waiting over an hour to be served for two of us while the other four are served on time - no one offering to apologize for any of the mess yet fine to add 18% gratuity on the total bill - sharing our disappointment and being asked for our phone number so they can remember to treat us better next time - food quality was about subpar; even tables next to us wouldn't finish or box the mounds of uneaten food on takeaway boxes

l5ilhRVoygUQ6uybfJRNoA.text: Say at the bar and ordered the sashimi omakase. The owner was very personable and made me feel right at home. The sushi was out of this world amazing! Family friendly environment and good prices. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sashimi Omakase (spicy tuna roll &amp; chef sashimi selection)

5s4CmdR1F0loJPi_uen9hQ.text: Bought some ramen. The broth is...ok. I've had better. Plus they charge you $3 to add meat, then give you a tiny piece of bone with a little meat on it. And the meat was pretty dry and chewy.  I didn't ask for onions and they gave me a bunch.  Over all, very disappointed. May order again due to the price, but I'm not adding any meat, that's for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. $3 for a vibe with a piece of overcooked, chewy pork

TwlYaztBZpBEKdknNLFBMg.text: Greatest sushi find in Scottsdale. Pricing is unbelievable not even taking into account the great location. Nigiri orders $3 for two pieces?  Where do you see that?  Quality is awesome and the staff is great. Atmosphere is...well let's just say retro and if you see it with those eyes your gonna walk out with a five star experience.   I'm so sick of walking out of sushi places feeling like I've just been taken advantage of. You will never walk out of Kyota with that in mind. And the have teppen yaki tables too!  Maybe next time, but as for now I just keep going in for the sushi.

AOHXfvDQb3aECNvw8banyQ.text: Lukewarm hibachi experience.    The fried rice is pre-made,  not prepared on the grill.   Also,  our chef chopped up the shrimp (I suspect to give the illusion you're getting more).    I ordered shrimp/chicken hibachi and  all of my shrimp was chopped up like "kibbles and bits" dog food.   (Do you really have to chop up medium sized shrimp, geeez aren't  they already shrimp??).   Also. The veggies were significantly over cooked.   The chicken was good.   On the other hand, Kyoto has superior customer service; when I discovered my fork was dirty (hard white material) they promptly brought me another one.

glV5M1-5JvloRbwMRsE01A.text: Been coming here for over 20 years and prices have hardly changed.  Great fresh sushi at the lowest prices around. 5 big pieces of fresh Tuna for $5 and all hot lunches under $5 as well. Has a very interesting night life on Friday and Saturday and $6 larger Japanese beer and sake.

jDj3Mzhzzl9Uc4MhNu7UfA.text: Update!  Went back last night for dinner, this place is still awesome. I had the Las Vegas Rolls, they were pure deep fried goodness.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. LAS VEGAS
Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

EACMXmmaDn7S9lk-6IihdQ.text: I was supposed to come for dinner here tonight for a friends birthday dinner. I have a gluten allergy however so I called ahead to make sure I would be able to eat. The man I spoke to on the phone was extremely rude and even acted offended that I was asking. He said they had gluten free soy sauce, but that they didn't really have any gluten free options which I found confusing. Am I supposed to have gf soy sauce on the side of nothing for dinner? He then said that they aren't an American restaurant so they don't have "the kind of stuff" to make things gluten free. I understand that not all restaurants are able to accommodate a gluten free menu or gluten free options, but his passive aggressive tone and rudeness were completely unwarranted. I simply inquired. I have also been to dozens of other Japanese restaurants that have gluten free options and much better customer service so I will be taking my business to one of those. Kyoto lost a party of 5 tonight. I hope his bad attitude was worth it to them.

A9FMpqiHWzamP1qrVLlIpw.text: I love this place! I been dining here for 12 years. Very low price for lunch and fish is flown fresh daily!

Vfd13y80H5oNtkikww4nTA.text: this review is for their lunch. One of the best values hidden in old town Scottsdale. I had their sashimi plater. for $8 you got 9 pieces of fresh sashimi, rice and salad. I have also tried their kautsu lunch and that is a steal as well.

c2wh2zprXbi2VFQUABGtSg.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE! I've been eating at Kyoto for years. The service is good, the food is amazing, and the atmosphere is chill.  My friends and I go here and love sitting around the table for teppanyaki because the showmen are really funny and entertaining.  I will keep going here and I will always name Kyoto first in my recommendations for great sushi places.

p3EvCjRbG-Atcs7a7E0CqQ.text: Been going here for over 20 years.  Sushi is world class.  Not a glam sushi bar with ok overpriced sushi.  Saki bombers $6.00, was $5 20 years ago.  They don't raise their prices very often.  Lunches are a great deal too.  Teppan tables are fun for special occasions.  Great old school sushi bar!!!

gUOw4U5xtQW3MviEKv5Pfw.text: I am originally from California and I have eaten at all sorts of sushi places.  For me, when I come to eat sushi, I am concerned about the sushi.  I have read some of the reviews below and don't know why people are concerned about the ambiance as much, or the selection of sake/wine, etc.    I would say if I were to come here again, I would not order rolls.  Their rolls were so thick I probably needed extra large chopsticks.  Their seaweed salad and sashimis on the other hand were absolutely delicious.  The price was very reasonable for the amount of food that we got.  I would come here again because this is one of the few quality tasting sushi places I have found so far in Arizona.

HG6N6mfpVqPb5Z3SBoW0DA.text: You won't find sushi anywhere in Arizona like Koyoto.  I've been eating sushi for 10+ years and have tried pretty much every where in Az and this place is very affordable,  large portions and incredibly delicious, you won't find any place like it.

HZI58L8LsHLFUxQLHvc4rA.text: Absolutely love this place. Can't get enough of it. I can't go too long without having some squid salad. I dream about it if it's been too long. The sushi and Teppan-Yaki are great. Can't wait to go again.

9GBp2esv-CtNWArb5Ly3JQ.text: Great place for hibachi and definitely worth a try for their sushi. The tables can get a little tight with a big group,  so be prepared to get really cozy with your neighbors. The chefs are awesome and highly entertaining. Sushi chefs definitely know what they are doing and the bartender was hilarious. Definitely worth checking out.

a5SDsL7A4ijbS1agpV44Eg.text: When I'm cruising PHX and can't make it to Sakana then I come here.    Friday and Saturday nite is like a frat party.  By now, any night in Scottsdale must be like a frat party.  Go midweek, sit at the bar and enjoy the quality of this place.  See you next month.

cWvcVP5sI2uXvs6PeOCd7g.text: One of the first sushi spots in that area and it should be the first on your list when you're craving some Japaness goodness.  We had the soft crab roll, volcano, icsh roll, and some white tail and octopus sashimi... BUT...WE WANTED MORE! Ugh unfortunately, my stupid tummy didn't have room for more, but there's always next time!

xD8VtKsDIkwkYhJcJSUB8Q.text: I've been to Kyoto about 100 times for lunch, and I've never been disappointed.  Great prices, and a very friendly staff.

VLQwv7WvWMKJ6xoYyCQcxg.text: We had such a bad experience after eating here. I'll start by saying the Teppanyaki was fine. Same ole, same ole on the tricks and overly salted food. When we left and went to pick up our car at the 'complimentary' valet however, they were already gone. We went back into the restaurant hoping the keys were with them. They weren't, and the Kyoto was useless. They basically told us we were on our own and didn't even bother to wish us good luck. They were so rude. I'll never go back

VpHGv4orTY1JoNCFfEj5Bw.text: Love love love! This is the go-to place when my boyfriend and I want sushi. And we are sushi lovers.  The prices are ridiculously low for the quality and location. Regardless of pricing, the sushi is still the best in the Valley (in my opinion). This is also coming from a Japanese girl :)  In our most recent visit, my boyfriend and I sat at the sushi bar and asked the chef for a recommendation. We ordered the Hawaiian Ono sashimi because of it, and it was tasty! We love our standard selection, but it's nice to order new things every now and then.  When you go for lunch, the specials are even cheaper in price and just as delicious. I have no complaints about this place.

OKPkt-ua-mfJZybocFLSsw.text: Food was excellent, the chef at the table was good, however the wait staff as well the bartender were extremely oblivious to their surroundings.  Not once was I offered another drink.  I constantly had to flag someone down in order to keep from being parched.

SjmRtpUusKq5PqW9DEt46w.text: Kyoto continues to be a rockin' good time! Every time I visit, Kyoto provides an activity dinner experience! Between the saki bombs, the entertaining chef and the good food, Kyoto has the tri-fecta. Be warned that on the weekends, you will experience a wait, so it's best to call ahead and make a reservation.

-mhIIkPDqExiaW4PkNj6yA.text: Went here for fathers day with my husband, 3 kids and two other adults. At first we were slightly frustrated because we had a reservation and still had to wait about 20 min, not as easy a task with 3 tiny humans. However, once we were seated they more than made up for it. I asked the hostess for some plain paper and pencils for the kids to draw on and she was more than happy to help out. The other staff brought out little chopstick helpers which the kids were thrilled they could use chopsticks for their food. The chef, which I think is the reason why we had to wait was for him - was TOTALLY worth it. He entertained the kids and even cut up their food "Mini" size, which is GREAT when you want to eat and you don't have to spend time cutting up their meat or veggies to smaller pieces. He even gave us some extra fire at the end per the kids request. The staff then brought out little light up heart necklaces for the kids too - which just made the night even more memorable. It was a wonderful dinner and fathers day and was great for the kids who were soooo entertained, we had just a great time.   As for the food - it was great, cooked how we liked it, well seasoned and well priced. The staff was on point making sure we had everything we needed, never ran out of water or drinks - they were extremely accommodating. This place would work for a different night out with adults or definitely if you have kids because they are well entertained. Already planning on taking them again for a fun dinner out.

4OrKJQIKMMUAXdNSQ0bjzA.text: Overpriced for the quality of food. Rice was hard imagine buying pre made rolls at your local grocery store all day.  Uhhh no thanks.  So I took my talents down to Farm & Craft where the drinks and food were far superior.

XLTAJJYc4DS0N6LE_DUd2Q.text: Food was very good. Hibachi chef wasn't as enthusiastic as I'm used to and wasn't considerate of my parties years, but the food was good. Sushi wasn't the bad, but what can you expect from a restaurant in the middle of the desert? Sushi chef's play loud pip music, which I didn't mind but if you're not a fan, you won't like it. I usually like more of a Japanese type feel. Not sure if I'd go again

dBXDA6py3ZBC_eq1GIWOxQ.text: Amazing service. Very accommodating and awesome sushi roll.  really loved the spicy tuna roll, vegetable rolls, and crispy shrimp appetizer

b4EzE6GXiqBMA2yga_V52Q.text: The food was great and the beer was cold BUT the main reason I'm coming back is because of Bailey, she was OUTSTANDING!!!  James

eSRAm8m5p19qkAgRNRkHqQ.text: If you're looking for the best sushi and teppanyaki in Scottsdale look no further! Quick service, delicious food, and just all around good experience. I've hit up all the sushi places in Scottsdale and Kyoto has the most authentic and creative sushi. Even my friend that frequents Japan is greatly impressed with everything this place has to offer.

3dcIhjgK4e8yMIktnSEyJw.text: $6 pint of Kirin and sake.  Sake bombs galore!!!  This is their doorbuster deal to attract customers.  It really works because I see every table have several orders of these (multiple by 5 if college students).  This deal is 5 stars alone!  Onto the next important topic: Teppanyaki.  This is the other main attraction at this establishment.  I'd say it's 90% show and 10% taste.  The show is outstanding.  I've been to a few of these teppanyaki restaurants and Kyoto receives the best award for being the most entertaining.  Unfortunately, the food is less desirable.  A medium rare steak is overcooked and without flavor even when sprinkled with their seasoning.  The chicken is dry even with the sauce glazed on top of it.  The scallop and lobster were meh too.  Overall, the $6 sake and teppanyaki showmanship will make a great night with friends.

JrIHC7bRLIBxuERpAAD3sg.text: I love this place. We come here every year for our anniversary or for a birthday. They are remodeling right now and will be open in February. This is much better than any other teppanyaki restaurant in all of Scottsdale. It is worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

1EDF188vyNdtljEc6N1wDw.text: Should have learned my lesson the first time after I ordered a noodle dish and they prepared it with the wrong noodles because they were out of the proper kind. Just received a postmates order for lunch, I ordered the Chicken teriyaki bento box. The chicken was a frozen chicken breast that had those fake grill marks on it, not appetizing whatsoever. Never Again!

582VlXlUeJyuzYd6f-RRJA.text: I used to go here before they remodeled/closed for a few years. I wanted to love it, but most things have changed from before. Besides the price increasing which is understandable for Scottsdale, their chicken terriyaki entree is completely different. Before it was covered with thick delicious sauce with yummy chunks of mushroom; now it is an almost flavorless watery sauce with a few tiny mushrooms. Their salad was also my favorite, which now tastes different and is served with bitter spring mix instead of the ice berg, that I think goes better with it... I am hoping for other guests they turn up the flavors a little. At $10 I can get a better tasting chicken from RA or Kabuki.

xP2jXtBjM19ew0t1QkpmTg.text: Food was good, service was terrible. Initial service was good but then the server disappeared for a good 30 minutes. I had to get up and ask her to come to our table to take additional drink orders (and I also let her know we hadn't gotten our salads yet and we were already eating our entrees).  This place needs serious attention when it comes to service. These things are such easy fixes, get 1-2 more people helping. While I was waiting for my fiance to get out of the bathroom, I heard to coworkers ranting about how someone complained about the service.

E75lWL_6Eo_WzU4O-ZLxhA.text: Worst experience ever! Once walking in it took waiter 15 min to even talk to use. We then ordered our main course and that took 30 min to get to us While waiting to get our main course we ordered a sushi roll. Then we received our main course after being there 40 min. My chicken also had a bone in it when I was eating it. Then waited for sushi for a hour and a half after being there. Then decide to just cancel the order because it took so long to get the sushi. The portions were small and not filling. I would much rather go to any other sushi place than this one. Will not be going back ever especially since I drove two hours to come try it.

ifg6KhL-KjjvMYbjafgXpQ.text: Service awesome. Very friendly and social. Sashimi very good.  $ for product over rated.  Lady got veggie roll $8.. nothing special. Happy hour sake bomb.. best deal there, $4.. haven't been able to find better. Roll average.  Haven't tried teppan yet, will go back for 2nd run at it.. the staff is the main reason we will return.

sJLzTRjPtGDkAKYlARLt0A.text: Yummy!!!! We really enjoyed our visit - didn't realize Kyoto's had been closed for two years and had only recently reopened two months prior. Very enjoyable!

jnw84jEABBkIZ9loF6r_5A.text: Had a variety of rolls and saki bombs.  Everything was fresh and tasted great.  Will definitely return.

qoZlIk8SQBCb6rLZyht0LQ.text: We've now dined here a few times the past couple of years during our Scottsdale vacations. We keep giving it another try. The 1st time was not bad. Each time since, it has become progressively worse. I'm sorry, but the food has been below mediocre in our most recent visits. For example, on our last visit a week ago, the taste and the texture of some of the sushi rolls was dreadful--like they had been made at some earlier time and had been sitting in a refrigerator for a quite a while. Another roll--one of their specials--just tasted like a gob of mayonnaise. In yet another specialty roll, the shrimp tempura within was stale and tasteless and overdone. Well, we have now given up on this place. To be fair, my rainbow roll was very good, and the sake flight--as well as the fellow who presented and discussed it--was excellent. But overall, this place is much much inferior to the several Japanese restaurants we frequent--in several different states.

fjTnCze7vdUJyPGW5shvGQ.text: This is my favorite sushi/teppan place to go! I'm so happy they have re-opened!! Our dinner last night was great as always. I highly recommend the crazy roll.

miBo96uRdczD78L08d6Ddw.text: Me, wife and daughter came here for my daughters birthday. We called in advance to see if we needed reservations. In which we did so I made a reservation for three letting them now that it was for a birthday. They asked for the birthday girls name and age.  When we arrived we were pleasantly meet by a host and the general manager, I believe his name was Daniel an older gentleman with a cane. He explained to us the parking situation since they had no valet driver but had signs stating only valet parking. After being sat at the end of the table not the middle since there was no one else joining our teppanyaki  table (keep in mine there were only two other tables in the restaurant a three top and a five top both being birth days. The host started off with our drinks and said our server would be with us shortly. After about 15 min. Our server came by to take our order which we ordered the tuna ta taki,edimami and the crazy roll. Once the edimami hit the table we place our order for the teppenaki order for the filet, my strip and scallops and the chicken. Half way through our main meal my wife's sushi roll arrives and I ask to see how long on my tuna tataki was going to be, but she said she forgot to put it in and if I would like her to. I told her that it would be fine since my steak was just about done. The teppanyaki chef was definitely green and still learning which was fine he was still very entertaining and even acknowledged my daughters birth day and was the best part of the meal. The food was ok very very very over priced for what you get compared to other teppanyaki After he was done and we were eating our meals our server was no ware to be found along with the rest of the servers. I ended up walking to the host stand to see if we could get some refills on our drinks and the host was very friendly and proceeded to get our drink order and refills. Our server finely came out from the back 45 min. Later to just drop off the check. The other two tables they came out and sang to the birthday people but did not for my daughter even though they were aware of her birthday.

_RrPcsY15z25O4FhXVAu4Q.text: I have been going to this place for thirty plus years. It is in serious need of an update inside and out. The upside is that the food is great and the prices are even better. We had tempura, a specialty sushi roll, and a chicken bento box for $20. Seriously good deal.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yummm
Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sushi bar

H3LImyD2sztZAQj4PPCnKA.text: The sushi was bomb but the sashim was so bad I actually did vomit in their bathroom the squid was not fresh at all and the hamachi was sour tasting.

20J9l-89T7qmHgCFbfhLmA.text: I was hoping that they would've revived this place.  The music is 80's, the photos on the wall are 80's and stop with the 10 TV's non-stop showing pictures of your food!  So tacky.  The floors are greasy and the smell of the grill is terrible.  The food is fair,  but super salty!  The staff was very sweet and they tried really hard.  This place could be a goldmine with better management.  Perfect location...would love to see it turn around!

YCC5aBIEvwbEO3sfFO59rQ.text: I went last night as a party of three. First visit for two of us. Three takeaways: food was just okay, filet mignon was not worth it and service was poor. Emphasis on the latter.  Food was what you may expect at a place like this - salty. So you're just bloated after the meal from all the sodium. Not their fault, but just the style of teppanyaki. The filet mignon didn't particularly do it for me, but it is a better piece of meat than the NY Strip so you can make you're own call there.  Service was just really poor. Our reservation was late getting started by about 20 minutes, but I wasn't really all that upset - some patrons take longer than others, I get it. But once we sat down, it took more than ten minutes for a server to come take our drink order. Enough time for the manager to come apologize and introduce her to us. We just got sodas that were never refilled throughout the meal until one of us asked for a refill. I don't think they would have ever noticed and it wasn't as if just one person was coming around. There was the server, two different food runners with water and the manager.  And then the final bit of disappointment was the rice coming out. I was halfway done with my meal before the rice ever made it. The other party at our table received theirs from a food runner and he looked at us and I said "three steamed," he acknowledged and appeared to go in the kitchen to retrieve three orders of white rice. Five more minutes go by and the server comes out to ask if all is going well and I let her know that we still don't have our rice. She goes and retrieves it immediately and once again, the manager comes out to apologize for the service.  I just felt from the beginning that our table in particular may have been an afterthought. I can tell that was observed at least to some degree by the staff with the two apologies from the manager. It might not be that way for everyone as I certainly hope the manager isn't walking around apologizing all evening.  If you're wanting a nice dinner out with friends, you can fare better at other options nearby for the same price point.

pISNydZW8BtGDtfdv0OWYw.text: Great happy hour prices.  Loved the sushi rolls and the tempura veggies were the bomb.

6Lq-RPZ4fwEz2aFBfHomBg.text: This was my first time experience of teppanyaki style Japanese food. Loved it. Sushi & chicken breast were supurb. I tried crunchy crab roll which was really delicious. Service was good. They have their own parking space which was a relief as it is pretty tough to get parking on weekend.

Uvzl2hVSy6Gtl-08gbaBKg.text: This hidden gem in the heart of old town Scottsdale is a must. Great sushi, cheap prices and casual environment. Service can be a hit or miss. The sushi bar is great as they are engaging and you learn about all different kinds of sushi! Stop in...you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

sgW0_nBth_3wTUvnYUxjHg.text: Good food, highly questionable service! Without a good location, and a long history, they would struggle... Someone needs some customer service training. Like their entire staff!

gBtQnjBFDwrMq8Buu8TSow.text: So happy this place reopened!  They're under new management and I am l loving the changes that have been implemented.  We took advantage of the hibachi table and our chef, Ivan, was not only professional and pleasant but I couldn't put down my fork.  I was already in deep with a food comma but I just couldn't stop.  I had the chicken and my boyfriend had the lobster, both excellent.  That fried rice though... nom.  We also had a couple of sake flights.  The desert sake flight was my favorite, I didn't even know pear flavored sake existed.  You can't go wrong coming here from the sushi to hibachi you will love the experience.

H7I8Qn45otMbK6YECeNxhg.text: Came here for lunch since we work close with a group of four. Took 20 minutes for our waters to arrive then 30 minutes for the food. The only good thing about this place is at least they brought the check out quickly. No complaints on food but with as much competition as there is in the area I hope this place figures it out before their employees are out of work.

cwbKAlgi9P6HbdRs-dF6mg.text: Sushi was good atmosphere was great. The service was awful. We ordered drinks from our waitress that seemed as if she was on drugs or just so ditsy because she didn't know the menu or anything about the restaurant or how to talk to customers. Anyway, we waited 15 min before finally asking why our drinks hadn't came. Our waitress was no where to be found the rest of our time at the restaurant. Also, she never brought out our meal we had to grab it ourselves from the sushi bar because nobody cared to wait on us.

FQ2asktm1-lO3YMN0_66yQ.text: Teppanyaki, Sushi, Bar & Mussels OUT OF THIS WORLD!  Whether I go to Kyoto for a special occasion and reserve a teppanyaki table, which is always a filling and fun, interactive experience, or grab a saki bomber and some sushi, I always say it's the best restaurant out there. They have a versatile menu, chefs that are approachable - both sushi and teppan have a great attitude and are super fun. Their bar has the BEST prices! One bartender told me that they have not changed their prices since they opened; something like 50 years ago!!! My only complaint is that they aren't open very often - I think their doors normally open around 6pm, and I'm not a senior citizen, but sometimes like to dine earlier :). Parking can be somewhat of a challenge, but it's to be expected in Scottsdale. I LOVE this place!!! Always have and always will!

photos.caption: Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Flaming plates :).  Teppan is sooo fun and delicious here!!!
Photo of Kyoto Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pineapple boat for my birthday one year!!!

sxYCjqsKlDpCvJzr-PMKZA.text: Best fried rice in town! Been coming here for years and the new ownership didn't miss a beat. Same authentic feel and the sushi was very fresh. Again, hands down the best fried rice I've ever had!

k24YakjUdCxF01XON6v8Fw.text: Went for sushi and cocktails on a Friday night. I don't have much to say about the cocktails. I had a gin martini. The sushi was superior. The fish was extremely fresh. Rice was cooked perfectly. The yellowtail had been flown in that morning and it melted in my mouth. The eel sauce balanced the saltiness of the soy. (Note: They even have gluten free tamari.) The ponzu sauce in the seaweed salad was rich with flavor. Not oily. Texture was spot on. Ambiance was a retro 80's Japanese vibe. Don't turn up this little gem. Considering the location, the prices were comparable with other sushi places in the area. Will go back again for sure.

8yzyGCYz5tTAuYdxkSksBQ.text: Terrible, server was rude.  No yum yum sauce. No flavor at all. Miso soup was very salty, as was the ginger dressing. Will never return

TpYlxBij_nGyCTTS0rtYHQ.text: The best sushi restaurant in Arizona! I have been going many Japanese restaurant. This is the one of selling fresh food with good price!!! I'm so so so happy this place came back to business after closed down for over 1 year.

wxciiq9HD9cn8ID-dWYsUw.text: The service was terrible, the bartender was working alone and took 30 minutes to get a drink. Also one of the staff had drank all of the Tito's tequila and replaced it with water. Our reservations as for 7:30pm and did not get seated till 9pm. In addition two people from our part got sick from the food. The previous owner from a year ago did a much better job at running the place. I will never come back.

2vDTeomSjqQW9vQlLHG-jg.text: Came here for a birthday, two of us had the teppanyaki and one had sushi. We all ordered drinks, all of which were disappointing. Two of the three sushi rolls ordered came out about 20 minutes before the teppanyaki chef, so she had already finished eating both of those by the time the chef came out. The last roll came out as we were finishing eating the teppanyaki. The sushi rolls were all good and the only reason for two stars instead of one. The two of us who ordered teppanyaki both got the filet mignon, both of which were the worst filets we've ever had. The meat was very sour and unpleasant. As others have mentioned, the veggies in the fried rice are frozen and the rice is bland. While the sushi was good, we won't be returning. There are other sushi restaurants in Phoenix and Scottsdale that are more affordable and far better.

l2eiwqOrDAH5LDa9QffpTg.text: Kyotos has become a mere shadow of its previous self.  This used to be the best sushi in town. No more. The food is now overpriced and mediocre. The last two times my wife and I have gone there we have left depressed recalling it's previous greatness. Kyotos is dead and should be avoided.

8jbLGAM5BpHLvh9d8likqg.text: Kyoto is back after a long renovation and its as great as ever. Many of the same chefs and staff and all of the same menu items and recipes. The Volcano Roll and Vegas Roll are 2 of our favorites . It's high quality sushi at a reasonable price. And the same local ownership service experience abounds.

M8Yxl_3jMxhp79uQi6J5dw.text: I have been here twice and both times I ordered a rare steak and both times I received a medium steak. The rest of the food is delicious though. The atmosphere and service is good. It's expensive though and I feel like there are better restraurants to drop 100 dollars at for two.

STUpEY_qTalXkHhL2taZzw.text: Great food, great service , and at an awesome location . Price have increased dramatically here in the last 6-9 months ... thus the 4 stars.

JB87BgvAvmdojT9g-OnEww.text: Iv been coming here since the late 80's, Masa the owner is a frend ,the service is great the atmosphere is great  , the food is execelent . thia place was the only Japaneese resturant in Scottsdale . it's the grandaddy of them all . There was a time I used to go there 3 times a week . This place is an institution in Phoenix  .Try it you will be pleased.

2cmry7_U25OjmyQZi96YTQ.text: Well, maybe my husband and I have been spoiled by all the great Japanese food available in Los Angeles. This place just does not have good Japanese food. Even something simple like chicken teriyaki and miso soup were not great. Chunky teriyaki chicken, plus big pieces of mushroom in chicken teriyaki and miso soup?! And the sushi and the sashimi were just not that great. What's up with big pieces of sea scallops for baked dynamite scallops?  So glad to be back in LA for yummy Japanese food again!

DJFu7dY2gAYpFo4uaUCRow.text: Can't beat this place for the price and atmosphere.  Saki Bombs for $6 and sushi and tepanyaki prices way cheaper than anyplace around.  Why go to Ra or Benihana when this place is in the heart of old town and way cheaper.  Highly recommend hitting up Kyoto for dinner before going out in Old Town.
